title: 假如 (jiǎrú) - If, supposing
short_explanation: Used to express hypothetical situations or conditions.
long_explanation: The Mandarin Chinese phrase '假如 (jiǎrú)' is a conjunction that is used to suppose or imagine a hypothetical situation or condition in the future or present. It is equivalent to 'if' or 'supposing' in English. When using '假如', it is important to note that it is usually used in more formal or written language.

examples.cn: 假如你来我家，我会做好吃的给你。
examples.pinyin: Jiǎrú nǐ lái wǒ jiā, wǒ huì zuò hǎochī de gěi nǐ.
examples.en: If you come to my house, I will make delicious food for you.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_假如_jiǎrú_-_If_supposing_20231230_假如你来我家我会做好吃的给你.mp3

examples.cn: 假如明天下雨，我们的照片就得取消了。
examples.pinyin: Jiǎrú míngtiān xià yǔ, wǒmen de zhàopiàn jiù dé qǔxiāo le.
examples.en: If it rains tomorrow, our picnic will have to be cancelled.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_假如_jiǎrú_-_If_supposing_20231230_假如明天下雨我们的照片就得取消了.mp3

examples.cn: 假如我有一百万美元，我会买一栋大房子。
examples.pinyin: Jiǎrú wǒ yǒu yī bǎi wàn měiyuán, wǒ huì mǎi yī dòng dà fángzi.
examples.en: If I had a million dollars, I would buy a big house.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_假如_jiǎrú_-_If_supposing_20231230_假如我有一百万美元我会买一栋大房子.mp3

examples.cn: 假如你不喜欢这个礼物，我可以去换一个你喜欢的。
examples.pinyin: Jiǎrú nǐ bù xǐhuān zhège lǐwù, wǒ kěyǐ qù huàn yīgè nǐ xǐhuān de.
examples.en: If you don't like this gift, I can go exchange it for one you do like.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_假如_jiǎrú_-_If_supposing_20231230_假如你不喜欢这个礼物我可以去换一个你喜欢的.mp3

title: 非...不可 (fēi... bùkě) - Must, have to
short_explanation: Used to express necessity or imperative action.
long_explanation: The phrase '非...不可 (fēi... bùkě)' in Mandarin Chinese is used to express the idea of 'must' or 'have to' in English. It enforces a strong necessity or emphasizes the importance of a particular action, showing that there is no other option or alternatives.

examples.cn: 为了健康，每天锻炼身体非常健康非健康不可。
examples.pinyin: Wèile jiànkāng, měitiān duànliàn shēntǐ fēicháng jiànkāng fēi jiànkāng bùkě.
examples.en: For health, exercising every day is a must.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_非不可_fēi_bùkě_-_Must_have_to_20231230_为了健康每天锻炼身体非常健康非健康不可.mp3

examples.cn: 要想学好中文，持之以恒非要学不可。
examples.pinyin: Yào xiǎng xué hǎo Zhōngwén, chízhīyǐhéng fēi yào xué bùkě.
examples.en: To learn Chinese well, you must persevere.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_非不可_fēi_bùkě_-_Must_have_to_20231230_要想学好中文持之以恒非要学不可.mp3

examples.cn: 参加这次旅行的人非买机票不可。
examples.pinyin: Cānjiā zhè cì lǚxíng de rén fēi mǎi jīpiào bùkě.
examples.en: People participating in this trip must buy airplane tickets.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_非不可_fēi_bùkě_-_Must_have_to_20231230_参加这次旅行的人非买机票不可.mp3

examples.cn: 他为了要得到那份工作非得全力以赴不可。
examples.pinyin: Tā wèile yào dédào nà fèn gōngzuò fēi děi quánlì yǐfù bùkě.
examples.en: He must do his best in order to get that job.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_非不可_fēi_bùkě_-_Must_have_to_20231230_他为了要得到那份工作非得全力以赴不可.mp3

title: 即便 (jíbiàn) - Even if, even though
short_explanation: Used to indicate a condition and its supposed or actual conclusion.
long_explanation: '即便 (jíbiàn)' is a conjunction used in Mandarin Chinese to illustrate a hypothetical situation where certain circumstances don't prevent a result from happening. It is akin to 'even if' or 'even though' in English and is used to express the idea that despite a certain situation or condition, a particular outcome will still occur.

examples.cn: 即便今天下雨，我们还是会去公园烧烤。
examples.pinyin: Jíbiàn jīntiān xià yǔ, wǒmen háishi huì qù gōngyuán shāokǎo.
examples.en: Even if it rains today, we will still go to the park for a barbecue.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_即便_jíbiàn_-_Even_if_even_though_20231230_即便今天下雨我们还是会去公园烧烤.mp3

examples.cn: 即便他还是一个学生，他已经写了很多科学论文。
examples.pinyin: Jíbiàn tā háishì yīgè xuéshēng, tā yǐjīng xiěle hěnduō kēxué lùnwén.
examples.en: Even though he is still a student, he has already written many scientific papers.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_即便_jíbiàn_-_Even_if_even_though_20231230_即便他还是一个学生他已经写了很多科学论文.mp3

examples.cn: 即便她对电影不感兴趣，她还是会陪我去电影院。
examples.pinyin: Jíbiàn tā duì diànyǐng bù gǎnxìngqù, tā háishi huì péi wǒ qù diànyǐngyuàn.
examples.en: Even if she's not interested in movies, she will still accompany me to the cinema.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_即便_jíbiàn_-_Even_if_even_though_20231230_即便她对电影不感兴趣她还是会陪我去电影院.mp3

examples.cn: 即便我的中国朋友不会说英语，我仍然可以用中文和他们交流。
examples.pinyin: Jíbiàn wǒ de Zhōngguó péngyǒu bù huì shuō Yīngyǔ, wǒ réngrán kěyǐ yòng Zhōngwén hé tāmen jiāoliú.
examples.en: Even though my Chinese friends can't speak English, I can still communicate with them in Chinese.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_即便_jíbiàn_-_Even_if_even_though_20231230_即便我的中国朋友不会说英语我仍然可以用中文和他们交流.mp3

title: 据说 (jùshuō) - It is said that, reportedly
short_explanation: It is used to report or convey information that the speaker has heard but not directly experienced or observed.
long_explanation: The Mandarin Chinese phrase '据说 (jùshuō)' is used to introduce a hearsay or to convey an information that is said to be true but which the speaker doesn't have personal confirmation or doesn't personally witnessed. It is often used when sharing news, stories or rumours, and is equivalent to the English expressions 'it is said that', 'reportedly', 'apparently'. The usage is widespread in both written and spoken Chinese.

examples.cn: 据说那家餐厅的菜超级美味，我明天想去尝试一下。
examples.pinyin: Jùshuō nà jiā cāntīng de cài chāojí měiwèi, wǒ míngtiān xiǎng qù chángshì yīxià.
examples.en: It is said that the food at that restaurant is super delicious, I want to try it tomorrow.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_据说_jùshuō_-_It_is_said_that_reportedly_20231230_据说那家餐厅的菜超级美味我明天想去尝试一下.mp3

examples.cn: 据说他失败了，没有过HSK五级的考试。
examples.pinyin: Jùshuō tā shībài le, méiyǒu guò HSK wǔ jí de kǎoshì.
examples.en: It is reportedly that he failed, he didn't pass the HSK Level 5 exam.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_据说_jùshuō_-_It_is_said_that_reportedly_20231230_据说他失败了没有过HSK五级的考试.mp3

examples.cn: 据说这个电影非常感人，许多观众都哭了。
examples.pinyin: Jùshuō zhège diànyǐng fēicháng gǎnrén, xǔduō guānzhòng dōu kū le.
examples.en: It is said that this movie is very touching, many audiences cried.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_据说_jùshuō_-_It_is_said_that_reportedly_20231230_据说这个电影非常感人许多观众都哭了.mp3

examples.cn: 据说这位艺术家的新作品将在下个月展出，我非常期待看到它。
examples.pinyin: Jùshuō zhè wèi yìshùjiā de xīn zuòpǐn jiāng zài xià gè yuè zhǎnchū, wǒ fēicháng qīdài kàn dào tā.
examples.en: Reportedly, this artist's new work will be exhibited next month, I am really looking forward to seeing it.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_据说_jùshuō_-_It_is_said_that_reportedly_20231230_据说这位艺术家的新作品将在下个月展出我非常期待看到它.mp3

title: 不是...而是... (bùshì... érshì...) - It's not... but...
short_explanation: This pattern is used to correct a mistaken assumption or to emphasize a contrast.
long_explanation: The phrase '不是...而是...' (bùshì... érshì...) in Mandarin Chinese is used to correct a mistaken assumption, emphasize a contrast, or to clarify the speaker's point. '不是' negates the idea or action that comes after it, while '而是' emphasizes the more correct or intended idea or action that follows. It is similar to the English usage of 'It's not... but...'.
formation: 不是 + Mistaken Assumption/Contrasting Element + 而是 + Correct Information/New Element

examples.cn: 我来这里不是去购物，而是看电影。
examples.pinyin: Wǒ lái zhèlǐ bùshì qù gòuwù, érshì kàn diànyǐng.
examples.en: I came here not to shop, but to watch a movie.

examples.cn: 我喜欢的不是咖啡，而是茶。
examples.pinyin: Wǒ xǐhuān de bùshì kāfēi, érshì chá.
examples.en: What I like is not coffee, but tea.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_不是而是_bùshì_érshì_-_Its_not_but_20231230_我喜欢的不是咖啡而是茶.mp3

examples.cn: 他不是我的朋友，而是我的兄弟。
examples.pinyin: Tā bùshì wǒ de péngyǒu, érshì wǒ de xiōngdì.
examples.en: He is not my friend, but my brother.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_不是而是_bùshì_érshì_-_Its_not_but_20231230_他不是我的朋友而是我的兄弟.mp3

examples.cn: 这不是我的错，而是他的错。
examples.pinyin: Zhè bùshì wǒ de cuò, érshì tā de cuò.
examples.en: It's not my fault, but his.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_不是而是_bùshì_érshì_-_Its_not_but_20231230_这不是我的错而是他的错.mp3

title: 至多 (zhìduō) - At most
short_explanation: Used to denote the maximum extent or quantity.
long_explanation: The Mandarin Chinese phrase '至多 (zhìduō)' is a common adverb used to represent the maximum amount or extent of something achievable, hence being equivalent to 'at most' in English. You may see this grammar point in situations where someone is making an estimation or setting an upper limit.

examples.cn: 我至多只能待一小时。
examples.pinyin: Wǒ zhìduō zhǐ néng dāi yīxiǎoshí.
examples.en: At most, I can only stay for one hour.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_至多_zhìduō_-_At_most_20231230_我至多只能待一小时.mp3

examples.cn: 这件事至多需要三天的时间来完成。
examples.pinyin: Zhè jiàn shì zhìduō xūyào sān tiān de shíjiān lái wánchéng.
examples.en: This task at most requires three days to complete.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_至多_zhìduō_-_At_most_20231230_这件事至多需要三天的时间来完成.mp3

examples.cn: 一个人至多吃两个汉堡就足够了。
examples.pinyin: Yīgè rén zhìduō chī liǎng gè hànbǎo jiù zúgòu le.
examples.en: A person would be full with, at most, two hamburgers.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_至多_zhìduō_-_At_most_20231230_一个人至多吃两个汉堡就足够了.mp3

examples.cn: 这个房间至多可以容纳十个人。
examples.pinyin: Zhège fángjiān zhìduō kěyǐ róngnà shí gè rén.
examples.en: This room can accommodate at most ten people.

title: 毫无 (háo wú) - Without, not in the least
short_explanation: Used to express the complete absence of something.
long_explanation: '毫无 (háo wú)' is a Chinese phrase meaning 'without' or 'not in the least'. It is used to emphasize the total absence or lack of a particular object, quality, or condition. This phrase is particularly common in written Chinese and is especially used over '没有' when you want to add more emphasis on the fact that there is not even a slight bit or hint of something.

examples.cn: 他对音乐毫无兴趣。
examples.pinyin: Tā duì yīnyuè háo wú xìngqù.
examples.en: He has no interest in music at all.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_毫无_háo_wú_-_Without_not_in_the_least_20231230_他对音乐毫无兴趣.mp3

examples.cn: 经过一天的辛苦努力，我们毫无收获。
examples.pinyin: Jīngguò yītiān de xīnkǔ nǔlì, wǒmen háo wú shōuhuò.
examples.en: After a whole day's hard work, we gained nothing at all.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_毫无_háo_wú_-_Without_not_in_the_least_20231230_经过一天的辛苦努力我们毫无收获.mp3

examples.cn: 她对自己的未来毫无信心。
examples.pinyin: Tā duì zìjǐ de wèilái háo wú xìnxīn.
examples.en: She has no confidence at all in her future.

title: 则 (zé) - Then, thus
short_explanation: Used to denote a result or consequence.
long_explanation: The Mandarin Chinese word '则 (zé)' is a conjunction that's equivalent to 'then' or 'thus' in English, primarily used as a transitional word to denote a result, a contrast, or a condition-consequence relationship. It helps in creating a sequence of events or a logical progression in a discussion or argument.

examples.cn: 如果你不好好学习，你则将无法顺利通过HSK考试。
examples.pinyin: Rúguǒ nǐ bù hǎohāo xuéxí，nǐ zé jiāng wúfǎ shùnlì tōngguò HSK kǎoshì。
examples.en: If you don't study well, then you will not be able to pass the HSK exam smoothly.

examples.cn: 全家人都去参加了派对，她则选择留在家里读书。
examples.pinyin: Quánjiā rén dōu qù cānjiāle pàiduì, tā zé xuǎnzé liú zài jiā lǐ dúshū.
examples.en: The whole family went to the party, and she, however, chose to stay home and read.

examples.en: He doesn't eat meat, his sister, on the other hand, likes eating meat.

title: 而已 (éryǐ) - That's all, nothing more than
short_explanation: Used to express that something is just like that and there is nothing more to it.
long_explanation: The Mandarin Chinese phrase '而已 (éryǐ)' is used to emphasize that the situation or action described is just as it appears, there's nothing more to it or no other higher, complex, or special significance. It translates to 'that's all', 'just', or 'nothing more than' in English.

examples.cn: 他只是个孩子而已，不要对他期望太高。
examples.pinyin: Tā zhǐshì gè háizi éryǐ, bú yào duì tā qīwàng tài gāo.
examples.en: He is just a child, nothing more. Don't have too high expectations for him.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_而已_éryǐ_-_Thats_all_nothing_more_than_20231230_他只是个孩子而已不要对他期望太高.mp3

examples.pinyin: Zhè zhǐshì gè cuòwù éryǐ, wǒmen kěyǐ gēngzhèng tā.
examples.en: This is just a mistake, nothing more. We can correct it.

examples.cn: 我只是喜欢喝咖啡而已，并不是咖啡成瘾。
examples.pinyin: Wǒ zhǐshì xǐhuān hē kāfēi éryǐ, bìng búshì kāfēi chéng yǐn.
examples.en: I just like drinking coffee, it's not a coffee addiction.

examples.cn: 他只是迟到了一次而已，不要对他这么严格。
examples.pinyin: Tā zhǐshì chídào le yīcì éryǐ, bú yào duì tā zhème yángé.
examples.en: He just arrived late once, don't be so strict with him.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_而已_éryǐ_-_Thats_all_nothing_more_than_20231230_他只是迟到了一次而已不要对他这么严格.mp3

title: 难道 (nándào) - Could it be that, isn't it?
short_explanation: Used to express surprise or doubt regarding something.
long_explanation: In Mandarin Chinese, '难道 (nándào)' is an adverb used to express disbelief, surprise, or apprehension regarding a particular situation or fact. It is equivalent to phrases like 'could it be that' or 'isn't it' in English. It's typically used in rhetorical questions where the speaker expects agreement or is sure of the statement's accuracy.

examples.cn: 难道你不知道他已经结婚了吗？
examples.pinyin: Nándào nǐ bù zhīdào tā yǐjīng jiéhūn le ma?
examples.en: Could it be that you don't know he's already married?

examples.cn: 难道你不喜欢吃巧克力吗？我以为所有的人都喜欢。
examples.pinyin: Nándào nǐ bù xǐhuān chī qiǎokèlì ma? Wǒ yǐwéi suǒyǒu de rén dōu xǐhuān.
examples.en: Could it be that you don't like eating chocolate? I thought everyone likes it.

examples.en: Could it be that you didn't hear what I said just now?

examples.cn: 难道他真的不知道这个规则吗？那简直不可能。
examples.pinyin: Nándào tā zhēn de bù zhīdào zhège guīzé ma? Nà jiǎnzhí bù kěnéng.
examples.en: Could it be that he really doesn't know this rule? That's simply impossible.

title: 不如 (bùrú) - Not as good as, inferior to
short_explanation: Used to indicate that something or someone is not as good as something or someone else.
long_explanation: The Mandarin phrase '不如 (bùrú)' is used to make comparisons, often expressing that something or someone is not as good as, or is inferior to, another thing or person. It is often used to express self-deprecation, or when comparing and finding oneself or another thing lacking in some way.
formation: Subject + 不如 + Comparative Subject + Rest of the sentence

examples.cn: 我不如他跑得快。
examples.pinyin: Wǒ bùrú tā pǎo de kuài.
examples.en: I'm not as fast as him running.

title: 无论如何 (wúlùn rúhé) - Anyhow, anyway, in any case
short_explanation: Used to express a certainty or determination that a particular outcome will occur, no matter what the circumstances may be.
long_explanation: The Mandarin Chinese phrase '无论如何 (wúlùn rúhé)' is used when you want to emphasize that no matter what the circumstances are, something must be done or something will happen. It is equivalent to saying 'anyhow', 'anyway', 'in any case' or 'no matter what' in English. It often appears at the beginning of the sentence to express a very strong determination.
formation: 无论如何, [what must happen] or [what one is determined to do].

examples.cn: 无论如何, 我都要成功。
examples.pinyin: Wúlùn rúhé, wǒ dōu yào chénggōng.
examples.en: No matter what, I must succeed.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_无论如何_wúlùn_rúhé_-_Anyhow_anyway_in_any_case_20231230_无论如何_我都要成功.mp3

examples.cn: 无论如何, 你都不能错过这次的音乐会。
examples.pinyin: Wúlùn rúhé, nǐ dōu bùnéng cuòguò zhè cì de yīnyuè huì.
examples.en: Anyhow, you can't miss this concert.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_无论如何_wúlùn_rúhé_-_Anyhow_anyway_in_any_case_20231230_无论如何_你都不能错过这次的音乐会.mp3

examples.cn: 无论如何, 我们必须保护环境。
examples.pinyin: Wúlùn rúhé, wǒmen bìxū bǎohù huánjìng.
examples.en: In any case, we must protect the environment.

examples.cn: 无论如何, 我都会支持你的决定。

examples.en: Anyway, I will support your decision.

title: 不得不 (bùdébù) - Have to, can't but
short_explanation: This phrase expresses an obligation or the inevitable.
long_explanation: The Mandarin phrase '不得不 (bùdébù)' indicates a necessity or compulsion. It can be translated to 'have to' or 'can't but' in English. It is used when the action is unavoidable or a responsibility that must be fulfilled. The cause of the necessity is often due to circumstance, rules, or natural causes.
formation: Subject + 不得不 + Verb + Rest of the sentence.

examples.cn: 我明天有个重要的面试，所以今晚我不得不提早入睡。
examples.pinyin: Wǒ míngtiān yǒu gè zhòngyào de miànshì, suǒyǐ jīnwǎn wǒ bùdébù tízǎo rùshuì.
examples.en: I have an important interview tomorrow, so I have to go to bed early tonight.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_不得不_bùdébù_-_Have_to_cant_but_20231230_我明天有个重要的面试所以今晚我不得不提早入睡.mp3

examples.cn: 由于航班延误，我们不得不在机场待一夜。
examples.pinyin: Yóuyú hángbān yánwù, wǒmen bùdébù zài jīchǎng dāi yī yè.
examples.en: Due to the flight delay, we have to stay overnight at the airport.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_不得不_bùdébù_-_Have_to_cant_but_20231230_由于航班延误我们不得不在机场待一夜.mp3

examples.cn: 因为我忘记带伞，我不得不在雨中等公车。
examples.pinyin: Yīnwèi wǒ wàngjì dài sǎn, wǒ bùdébù zài yǔ zhōng děng gōngchē.
examples.en: Since I forgot to bring an umbrella, I had to wait for the bus in the rain.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_不得不_bùdébù_-_Have_to_cant_but_20231230_因为我忘记带伞我不得不在雨中等公车.mp3

examples.cn: 我不得不承认，这门课比我想象的要难多了。
examples.pinyin: Wǒ bùdébù chéngrèn, zhè mén kè bǐ wǒ xiǎngxiàng de yào nán duōle.
examples.en: I have to admit, this class is much harder than I thought it would be.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_不得不_bùdébù_-_Have_to_cant_but_20231230_我不得不承认这门课比我想象的要难多了.mp3

title: 不然 (bùrán) - Otherwise, If not
short_explanation: Used to express a hypothetical consequence that is undesirable or unwanted.
long_explanation: The Mandarin Chinese phrase '不然 (bùrán)' is equivalent to 'otherwise' or 'if not' in English. It's usually used in a conditional sentence to express a consequence that would happen if the condition in the first part of the sentence is not met. This consequence is typically undesirable or unfavorable.

examples.cn: 我们必须得快点儿，不然火车就走了。
examples.pinyin: Wǒmen bìxū děi kuàidiǎner, bùrán huǒchē jiù zǒu le.
examples.en: We must hurry, otherwise the train will leave.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_不然_bùrán_-_Otherwise_If_not_20231230_我们必须得快点儿不然火车就走了.mp3

examples.cn: 你必须要等他回来才可以走，不然他会很担心你。
examples.pinyin: Nǐ bìxū yào děng tā huílái cái kěyǐ zǒu, bùrán tā huì hěn dānxīn nǐ.
examples.en: You must wait for him to return before you can leave, otherwise he will worry about you.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_不然_bùrán_-_Otherwise_If_not_20231230_你必须要等他回来才可以走不然他会很担心你.mp3

examples.cn: 你最好把作业写完，不然老师会生你的气。
examples.pinyin: Nǐ zuì hǎo bǎ zuòyè xiě wán, bùrán lǎoshī huì shēng nǐ de qì.
examples.en: You'd better finish your homework, otherwise the teacher will be angry with you.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_不然_bùrán_-_Otherwise_If_not_20231230_你最好把作业写完不然老师会生你的气.mp3

examples.cn: 吃早餐，不然你会饿在上课的时候。
examples.pinyin: Chī zǎocān, bùrán nǐ huì è zài shàngkè de shíhòu.
examples.en: Eat breakfast, otherwise you will get hungry during class.

title: 不管...都... (bùguǎn... dōu...) - Regardless of... always...
short_explanation: This structure is used to convey 'no matter what/who/where, etc., always...'
long_explanation: In Mandarin Chinese, '不管...都...' is a common grammatical framework that expresses 'regardless of certain conditions, the following statement is always true'. It is akin to 'no matter what/who/where/etc., always' in English. The condition statement is preceded by 不管, and the consequential statement or result follows 都.

examples.cn: 不管你是否同意，我都要做这件事。
examples.pinyin: Bùguǎn nǐ shìfǒu tóngyì, wǒ dōu yào zuò zhè jiàn shì.
examples.en: Regardless of whether you agree or not, I will do this.

examples.cn: 不管天气怎么样，他都会每天运动一个小时。
examples.pinyin: Bùguǎn tiānqì zěnme yàng, tā dōu huì měitiān yùndòng yī gè xiǎoshí.
examples.en: No matter what the weather is like, he will exercise for an hour every day.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_不管都_bùguǎn_dōu_-_Regardless_of_always_20231230_不管天气怎么样他都会每天运动一个小时.mp3

examples.cn: 不管多么困难，我都不会放弃帮助你。
examples.pinyin: Bùguǎn duōme kùnnán, wǒ dōu bù huì fàngqì bāngzhù nǐ.
examples.en: No matter how difficult it is, I will never give up helping you.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_不管都_bùguǎn_dōu_-_Regardless_of_always_20231230_不管多么困难我都不会放弃帮助你.mp3

examples.cn: 不管他说什么，我都不会改变我的决定。
examples.pinyin: Bùguǎn tā shuō shénme, wǒ dōu bù huì gǎibiàn wǒ de juédìng.
examples.en: No matter what he says, I will not change my decision.

title: 唯有 (wéiyǒu) - Only, alone
short_explanation: 唯有 (wéiyǒu) is used to express exclusivity or to suggest a single solution to a problem or condition.
long_explanation: 唯有 (wéiyǒu) literally translates to 'only have'. This phrase usually indicates an exclusive single possibility, solution, condition or criterion. It generally emphasizes that only a particular factor is capable of achieving certain goals or making the situation change.

examples.cn: 唯有努力学习，才能通过汉语水平考试。
examples.pinyin: Wéiyǒu nǔlì xuéxí, cáinéng tōngguò Hànyǔ shuǐpíng kǎoshì.
examples.en: Only by studying hard can you pass the Chinese proficiency test.

examples.en: Only time can heal the pain in our hearts.

examples.cn: 唯有保持积极的态度，我们才能战胜困难。
examples.pinyin: Wéiyǒu bǎochí jījí de tàidù, wǒmen cáinéng zhànshèng kùnnán.
examples.en: Only by maintaining a positive attitude can we overcome difficulties.

title: 那般 (nà bān) - So, such
short_explanation: Used to express the extent or degree of something.
long_explanation: The Mandarin Chinese phrase '那般 (nà bān)' is used to describe the extent or degree of a particular trait, action, or situation. This phrase is typically used to emphasize the degree or extent to which something is true or evident, providing an equivalent expression to 'so' or 'such' in English.

examples.cn: 他那般喜欢你，你难道没感觉吗？
examples.pinyin: Tā nà bān xǐhuān nǐ, nǐ nándào méi gǎnjué ma?
examples.en: He likes you so much, don't you feel it?

examples.pinyin: Wǒ cóngwèi jiànguò nà bān měilì de fēngjǐng.

examples.cn: 那个人那般善良，你为什么要伤害他？
examples.pinyin: Nàgè rén nà bān shànliáng, nǐ wèishéme yào shānghài tā?

title: 以至于 (yǐzhìyú) - So... that...
short_explanation: Used to indicate the result of something to a certain extent or degree.
long_explanation: The Mandarin Chinese phrase '以至于 (yǐzhìyú)' indicates a certain result that comes about due to an extent or degree of a situation, event, or action. It is equivalent to 'so... that...' in English and is used to highlight the impact or outcome of a scenario. This phrase is useful when you want to emphasize the significance or severity of a result or consequence.

examples.cn: 他工作太努力，以至于没有时间照顾自己的健康。
examples.pinyin: Tā gōngzuò tài nǔlì, yǐzhìyú méiyǒu shíjiān zhàogù zìjǐ de jiànkāng.
examples.en: He works so hard that he doesn't have time to take care of his health.

examples.cn: 他的中文说得太好，以至于我以为他是中国人。
examples.pinyin: Tā de Zhōngwén shuō dé tài hǎo, yǐzhìyú wǒ yǐwéi tā shì Zhōngguó rén.
examples.en: His Chinese is so good that I thought he was Chinese.

examples.cn: 她钢琴弹得太好听，以至于每次听到她的演奏，我都会感动得流泪。

examples.en: She plays the piano so beautifully that every time I hear her play, I'm moved to tears.

examples.cn: 这部电影太搞笑，以至于我笑得肚子都疼了。

title: 若非 (ruò fēi) - If not for, but for
short_explanation: Used to express condition and hypothetical situations, indicating 'if it were not for' or 'but for'.
long_explanation: The Mandarin Chinese phrase '若非 (ruò fēi)' is used to describe a hypothetical condition, and is similar to the English phrases 'if it were not for' or 'but for'. This phrase is often used to emphasize the importance of a certain condition or factor in a situation, and to speculate about what would happen if that condition or factor were not present.

examples.cn: 若非你的帮助，我可能无法完成这项任务。
examples.pinyin: Ruò fēi nǐ de bāngzhù, wǒ kěnéng wúfǎ wánchéng zhè xiàng rènwù.

examples.cn: 若非她的鼓励，我可能早就放弃了。
examples.pinyin: Ruò fēi tā de gǔlì, wǒ kěnéng zǎojiù fàngqìle.
examples.en: If not for her encouragement, I might have given up a long time ago.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_若非_ruò_fēi_-_If_not_for_but_for_20231230_若非她的鼓励我可能早就放弃了.mp3

examples.cn: 若非他的指导，我们无法做好这项工作。
examples.pinyin: Ruò fēi tā de zhǐdǎo, wǒmen wúfǎ zuò hǎo zhè xiàng gōngzuò.
examples.en: If it were not for his guidance, we could not do this job well.

examples.cn: 若非你提醒我，我可能会忘记这个重要的约会。
examples.pinyin: Ruò fēi nǐ tíxǐng wǒ, wǒ kěnéng huì wàngjì zhè gè zhòngyào de yuēhuì.
examples.en: But for your reminder, I might forget this important appointment.

title: 要么...要么... (yàome... yàome...) - Either... or...
short_explanation: Used to present alternatives or to indicate that there are only two choices.
long_explanation: The Mandarin Chinese phrase '要么...要么...' (yàome... yàome...) is a conversational structure used to express the idea of 'either... or...'. This structure is used when there are two alternative choices and one must be selected. It suggests that if the first condition isn't met, then the second condition will be.
formation: Subject + 要么 + Option A, 要么 + Option B

examples.cn: 你要么吃了午饭再继续工作，要么就是现在就休息一下。
examples.pinyin: Nǐ yàome chī le wǔfàn zài jìxù gōngzuò, yàome jiùshì xiànzài jiù xiūxí yīxià.
examples.en: Either have lunch first and then continue to work, or take a break now.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_要么要么_yàome_yàome_-_Either_or_20231230_你要么吃了午饭再继续工作要么就是现在就休息一下.mp3

examples.cn: 这个周末我们要么去山上爬山，要么去海边游泳。
examples.pinyin: Zhège zhōumò wǒmen yàome qù shānshàng páshān, yàome qù hǎibiān yóuyǒng.
examples.en: This weekend, we either go mountain climbing, or go swimming at the beach.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_要么要么_yàome_yàome_-_Either_or_20231230_这个周末我们要么去山上爬山要么去海边游泳.mp3

examples.cn: 你要么接受这个工作，要么去其他的公司寻找。
examples.pinyin: Nǐ yàome jiēshòu zhège gōngzuò, yàome qù qítā de gōngsī xúnzhǎo.
examples.en: You either accept this job, or look for others in different companies.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_要么要么_yàome_yàome_-_Either_or_20231230_你要么接受这个工作要么去其他的公司寻找.mp3

examples.cn: 你要么忍受他的行为，要么就与他分手。
examples.pinyin: Nǐ yàome rěnshòu tā de xíngwéi, yàome jiù yǔ tā fēnshǒu.
examples.en: Either put up with his behavior, or break up with him.

title: 不是...就是... (bùshì... jiùshì...) - Either... or...
short_explanation: This is used to present two or more possibilities.
long_explanation: The phrase '不是...就是...' in Mandarin Chinese expresses the meaning of 'either... or...'. It's used to indicate two or more possibilities or alternatives. You use it when you want to express that the scenario or outcome must be one of the options provided in the sentence.
formation: 不是 + Option 1 + 就是 + Option 2

examples.cn: 他们周末不是去爬山就是去逛公园。

title: 尽管...但是... (jǐnguǎn... dànshì...) - Although... but...
short_explanation: Used to present contrast between two clauses.
long_explanation: The Mandarin Chinese phrase '尽管...但是... (jǐnguǎn... dànshì...)' is a structure used to introduce a contrast or discrepancy between two situations or facts. The clause following '尽管 (jǐnguǎn)' states a circumstance, and the clause after '但是 (dànshì)' presents an unexpected or contrary result. It is equivalent to the 'although... but...' structure in English.
formation: 尽管 + Statement A, 但是 + Statement B

examples.cn: 尽管他已经很努力的工作，但是他还是没有完成任务。
examples.pinyin: Jǐnguǎn tā yǐjīng hěn nǔlì de gōngzuò, dànshì tā háishì méiyǒu wánchéng rènwu.
examples.en: Although he has been working hard, he still hasn't completed the task.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_尽管但是_jǐnguǎn_dànshì_-_Although_but_20231230_尽管他已经很努力的工作但是他还是没有完成任务.mp3

examples.cn: 尽管今天天气很冷，但是我们还是去公园玩了。
examples.pinyin: Jǐnguǎn jīntiān tiānqì hěn lěng, dànshì wǒmen háishì qù gōngyuán wán le.
examples.en: Although it is cold today, we still went to the park to have fun.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_尽管但是_jǐnguǎn_dànshì_-_Although_but_20231230_尽管今天天气很冷但是我们还是去公园玩了.mp3

examples.cn: 尽管他们的团队人数少，但是他们赢了比赛。
examples.pinyin: Jǐnguǎn tāmen de tuánduì rénshù shǎo, dànshì tāmen yíng le bǐsài.
examples.en: Although their team was few in number, they won the match.

examples.cn: 尽管她的成绩好，但是她仍然每天都在学习。
examples.pinyin: Jǐnguǎn tā de chéngjì hǎo, dànshì tā réngrán měitiān dōu zài xuéxí.
examples.en: Although her grades are good, she still studies every day.

title: 除非...否则... (chúfēi... fǒuzé...) - Unless... otherwise...
short_explanation: Used to express the meaning of 'unless... otherwise...' in English. It represents a condition and a consequence.
long_explanation: The Chinese phrase '除非...否则...' is used to express a conditional sentence that shows the understanding of 'unless... otherwise...'. '除非' presents the condition, and '否则' introduces the result that will happen if the condition is not met.
formation: 除非 + Condition, 否则 + Consequence

examples.cn: 除非你努力工作，否则你不能得到晋升。
examples.pinyin: Chúfēi nǐ nǔlì gōngzuò, fǒuzé nǐ bùnéng dédào jìnshēng.
examples.en: Unless you work hard, you can't get a promotion.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_除非否则_chúfēi_fǒuzé_-_Unless_otherwise_20231230_除非你努力工作否则你不能得到晋升.mp3

examples.cn: 除非你吃药，否则发烧就不会降低。
examples.pinyin: Chúfēi nǐ chī yào, fǒuzé fāshāo jiù bù huì jiàngdī.
examples.en: Unless you take medicine, the fever won't come down.

examples.cn: 除非你每天都练习，否则你的中文不会提高。
examples.pinyin: Chúfēi nǐ měitiān dōu liànxí, fǒuzé nǐ de Zhōngwén bù huì tígāo.
examples.en: Unless you practice every day, your Chinese won't improve.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_除非否则_chúfēi_fǒuzé_-_Unless_otherwise_20231230_除非你每天都练习否则你的中文不会提高.mp3

examples.cn: 除非你现在就开始准备，否则你可能无法及时完成这项任务。
examples.pinyin: Chúfēi nǐ xiànzài jiù kāishǐ zhǔnbèi, fǒuzé nǐ kěnéng wúfǎ jíshí wánchéng zhè xiàng rènwù.
examples.en: Unless you start preparing now, you may not be able to complete this task on time.

title: 与其...不如... (yǔqí... bùrú...) - Rather than... it's better to...
short_explanation: Used to express a preference for one action or situation over another.
long_explanation: The Mandarin Chinese phrase '与其...不如...' (yǔqí... bùrú...) is equivalent to 'rather than... it's better to...' in English. It is used to indicate that one action or situation is preferred or considered more beneficial or suitable over another. This phrase is commonly used to express decision-making or preference based on a comparison between two possible options.
formation: 与其 + Action or situation A + 不如 + Preferred action or situation B

examples.cn: 与其在家里看电视，不如出去散步。
examples.pinyin: Yǔqí zài jiālǐ kàn diànshì, bùrú chūqù sànbù.
examples.en: Rather than watching TV at home, it's better to go out for a walk.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_与其不如_yǔqí_bùrú_-_Rather_than_its_better_to_20231230_与其在家里看电视不如出去散步.mp3

examples.cn: 与其花很多钱买一个新手机，不如修理我现有的手机。

examples.en: Rather than spend a lot of money on a new phone, it's better to fix my existing phone.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_与其不如_yǔqí_bùrú_-_Rather_than_its_better_to_20231230_与其花很多钱买一个新手机不如修理我现有的手机.mp3

examples.cn: 与其每天吃快餐，不如自己学做饭。
examples.pinyin: Yǔqí měitiān chī kuàicān, bùrú zìjǐ xué zuòfàn.

examples.cn: 与其早早儿起床去游泳，不如睡个懒觉。

examples.en: Rather than getting up early to go swimming, it's better to sleep in.

title: 即使 (jíshǐ) - Even if, even though
short_explanation: Used to indicate hypothetical situations or conditions.
long_explanation: The Mandarin Chinese phrase '即使 (jíshǐ)' is used to express the meaning of 'even if' or 'even though'. It introduces a hypothetical or concessive clause, setting up a condition that, despite its fulfillment, will not affect the outcome of the main clause. The structure is often used to display a strong determination or an unchangeable fact.
formation: 即使 + Hypothetical Situation + Main Clause

examples.cn: 即使下大雨，他也决定出门去跑步。
examples.pinyin: Jíshǐ xià dàyǔ, tā yě juédìng chūmén qù pǎobù.
examples.en: Even if it rains heavily, he decides to go out for a run.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_即使_jíshǐ_-_Even_if_even_though_20231230_即使下大雨他也决定出门去跑步.mp3

examples.cn: 即使他们一开始并不理解，我还是会坚持去做我认为正确的事情。
examples.pinyin: Jíshǐ tāmen yī kāishǐ bìng bù lǐjiě, wǒ háishì huì jiānchí qù zuò wǒ rènwéi zhèngquè de shìqíng.
examples.en: Even if they don't understand at first, I will still insist on doing what I believe to be right.

examples.cn: 即使明天是世界末日，我今天还会做我的功课。
examples.pinyin: Jíshǐ míngtiān shì shìjiè mòrì, wǒ jīntiān hái huì zuò wǒ de gōngkè.

examples.cn: 即使我明天有很重要的考试，我今天晚上还想看这场篮球比赛。

examples.en: Even if I have a very important exam tomorrow, I still want to watch this basketball game tonight.

title: 既...又... (jì... yòu...) - Both... and...
short_explanation: A coordinative structure used to express and emphasize both qualities or actions in Mandarin Chinese.
long_explanation: The grammar structure '既...又...' in Mandarin Chinese is a coordinative structure used to express two or more qualities or actions happening at the same time. It serves a similar purpose to 'both...and...' in English. Usually, the characteristics or actions expressed by '既...又...' are in a positive light and are mutually reinforcing.
formation: Subject + 既 + Description 1 + 又 + Description 2

examples.cn: 这个手机既轻又薄，非常适合带出门。
examples.pinyin: Zhège shǒujī jì qīng yòu báo, fēicháng shìhé dài chūmén.
examples.en: This mobile phone is both light and thin, very suitable to carry out.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_既又_jì_yòu_-_Both_and_20231230_这个手机既轻又薄非常适合带出门.mp3

examples.cn: 她既聪明又勤奋，成绩总是名列前茅。
examples.pinyin: Tā jì cōngmíng yòu qínfèn, chéngjì zǒng shì míngliè qiánmáo.
examples.en: She is both smart and diligent, her grades are always at the top.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_既又_jì_yòu_-_Both_and_20231230_她既聪明又勤奋成绩总是名列前茅.mp3

examples.cn: 这家餐厅的食物既美味又健康。
examples.pinyin: Zhè jiā cāntīng de shíwù jì měiwèi yòu jiànkāng.
examples.en: The food in this restaurant is both delicious and healthy.

examples.cn: 我喜欢这个城市，既有现代化的设施，又保留了古老的风貌。
examples.pinyin: Wǒ xǐhuān zhège chéngshì, jì yǒu xiàndàihuà de shèshī, yòu bǎoliúle gǔlǎo de fēngmào.
examples.en: I like this city, it both has modern facilities and retains the old look.

title: 由此可见 (yóucǐ kějiàn) - From this, one can see that...
short_explanation: Used to draw a conclusion based on the previous information or statement.
long_explanation: '由此可见 (yóucǐ kějiàn)' is a logical expression in Mandarin Chinese that means 'from this, one can see that...'. It's typically used after presenting some facts or observations, and it helps to summarize or draw a conclusion based on the information previously mentioned. It is similar to saying 'therefore' or 'hence' in English.

examples.cn: 他每天都在学习上花费了很多时间，由此可见，他对学习非常认真。
examples.pinyin: Tā měitiān dōu zài xuéxí shàng huāfèi le hěnduō shíjiān, yóucǐ kějiàn, tā duì xuéxí fēicháng rènzhēn.
examples.en: He spends a lot of time studying every day, from this, one can see that he takes his studies very seriously.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_由此可见_yóucǐ_kějiàn_-_From_this_one_can_see_that_20231230_他每天都在学习上花费了很多时间由此可见他对学习非常认真.mp3

examples.cn: 他经常帮助别人，由此可见，他是一个善良的人。
examples.pinyin: Tā jīngcháng bāngzhù biérén, yóucǐ kějiàn, tā shì yīgè shànliáng de rén.
examples.en: He often helps others, from this, one can see that he is a kind person.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_由此可见_yóucǐ_kějiàn_-_From_this_one_can_see_that_20231230_他经常帮助别人由此可见他是一个善良的人.mp3

examples.cn: 他每天都坚持锻炼，由此可见，他很注意健康。
examples.pinyin: Tā měitiān dōu jiānchí duànliàn, yóucǐ kějiàn, tā hěn zhùyì jiànkāng.
examples.en: He insists on exercising every day, from this, one can see that he pays great attention to his health.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_由此可见_yóucǐ_kějiàn_-_From_this_one_can_see_that_20231230_他每天都坚持锻炼由此可见他很注意健康.mp3

examples.cn: 他的篮球技术在同学中是最好的，由此可见，他在篮球方面肯定投入了很多时间和努力。
examples.pinyin: Tā de lánqiú jìshù zài tóngxué zhōng shì zuì hǎo de, yóucǐ kějiàn, tā zài lánqiú fāngmiàn kěndìng tóurù le hěnduō shíjiān hé nǔlì.
examples.en: His basketball skills are the best among his classmates, from this, one can see that he must have put a lot of time and effort into basketball.

title: 至于 (zhìyú) - As for, regarding
short_explanation: Used to change the topic or to mention another subject related to the previous one.
long_explanation: The Mandarin Chinese phrase '至于 (zhìyú)' is a conjunction used to transition to a new topic that is somewhat related to the previous one, or to provide additional information or comments about a different aspect of the matter under discussion. It can be translated as 'as for,' 'regarding,' 'concerning,' or 'with respect to' in English.
formation: Paragraph + 至于 + New Topic + Comment

examples.cn: 我喜欢吃苹果，至于你，你喜欢吃什么？
examples.pinyin: Wǒ xǐhuān chī píngguǒ, zhìyú nǐ, nǐ xǐhuān chī shénme?
examples.en: I like to eat apples, as for you, what do you like to eat?
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_至于_zhìyú_-_As_for_regarding_20231230_我喜欢吃苹果至于你你喜欢吃什么.mp3

examples.cn: 你弟弟已经决定去北京大学。至于你，你有没有想过读研究生的打算？
examples.pinyin: Nǐ dìdì yǐjīng juédìng qù Běijīng Dàxué. Zhìyú nǐ, nǐ yǒu méiyǒu xiǎngguò dú yánjiūshēng de dǎsuàn?
examples.en: Your younger brother has decided to go to Beijing University. As for you, have you ever thought about the plan to read a postgraduate?

examples.cn: 我父母会去买东西，至于我，我将留在家里修理自行车。

examples.en: My parents will go shopping, as for me, I will stay at home to fix the bicycle.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_至于_zhìyú_-_As_for_regarding_20231230_我父母会去买东西至于我我将留在家里修理自行车.mp3

examples.cn: 这个问题我可以解决。至于其他问题，我们需要找专家来帮忙。

examples.en: I can solve this problem. As for other problems, we need to find experts to help.

title: 毕竟 (bìjìng) - After all / When all is said and done
short_explanation: Used to convey the essential facts of a situation that need to be considered or remembered.
long_explanation: The Mandarin Chinese phrase '毕竟 (bìjìng)' is used to highlight the essential facts or reality of a situation, particularly after considering various factors. It's equivalent to the English phrases 'after all' or 'when all is said and done'. This phrase is often used to emphasize the overall significance or important aspects of a phenomenon or occurrence.

examples.cn: 毕竟我是你的朋友，我会帮你的。
examples.pinyin: Bìjìng wǒ shì nǐ de péngyǒu, wǒ huì bāng nǐ de.
examples.en: After all, I am your friend, I will help you.

examples.cn: 虽然他不太善于表达自己，但是毕竟他是个好人。

examples.en: Although he is not good at expressing himself, after all, he is a good person.

examples.cn: 这个项目虽然有挑战，但毕竟有益于我们的业务发展。
examples.pinyin: Zhège xiàngmù suīrán yǒu tiǎozhàn, dàn bìjìng yǒuyì yú wǒmen de yèwù fāzhǎn.
examples.en: This project is challenging, but after all, it is beneficial to our business development.

examples.cn: 他的房子离市中心很远，但毕竟他住得很舒服。

title: 反之 (fǎnzhī) - On the contrary, conversely
short_explanation: Used to express an opposite situation or condition.
long_explanation: The Mandarin Chinese phrase '反之 (fǎnzhī)' is most equivalent to 'on the contrary' or 'conversely' in English. It is used to introduce a statement or idea which reverses the one that has just been mentioned. It serves as a contrasting conjunction that provides a helpful way of stressing a reverse situation or condition.

examples.cn: 他对我非常友好，反之我对他冷淡。
examples.pinyin: Tā duì wǒ fēicháng yǒuhǎo, fǎnzhī wǒ duì tā lěngdàn.
examples.en: He is very friendly to me, on the contrary, I am indifferent to him.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_反之_fǎnzhī_-_On_the_contrary_conversely_20231230_他对我非常友好反之我对他冷淡.mp3

examples.cn: 如果你尊重别人，别人也会尊重你，反之，如果你不尊重别人，别人也会不尊重你。
examples.pinyin: Rúguǒ nǐ zūnzhòng biérén, biérén yě huì zūnzhòng nǐ, fǎnzhī, rúguǒ nǐ bù zūnzhòng biérén, biérén yě huì bù zūnzhòng nǐ.
examples.en: If you respect others, others will respect you, conversely, if you don't respect others, others will not respect you.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_反之_fǎnzhī_-_On_the_contrary_conversely_20231230_如果你尊重别人别人也会尊重你反之如果你不尊重别人别人也会不尊重你.mp3

examples.cn: 做运动可以让你的身体健康，反之，如果你不运动，你的身体可能会变得很弱。
examples.pinyin: Zuò yùndòng kěyǐ ràng nǐ de shēntǐ jiànkāng, fǎnzhī, rúguǒ nǐ bù yùndòng, nǐ de shēntǐ kěnéng huì biàn dé hěn ruò.
examples.en: Exercising can make your body healthy, on the contrary, if you do not exercise, your body may become very weak.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_反之_fǎnzhī_-_On_the_contrary_conversely_20231230_做运动可以让你的身体健康反之如果你不运动你的身体可能会变得很弱.mp3

examples.cn: 如果你努力学习，你可以取得好成绩，反之，如果你不努力学习，你可能会挂科。
examples.pinyin: Rúguǒ nǐ nǔlì xuéxí, nǐ kěyǐ qǔdé hǎo chéngjì, fǎnzhī, rúguǒ nǐ bù nǔlì xuéxí, nǐ kěnéng huì guà kē.
examples.en: If you study hard, you can achieve good grades, conversely, if you do not study hard, you may fail.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_反之_fǎnzhī_-_On_the_contrary_conversely_20231230_如果你努力学习你可以取得好成绩反之如果你不努力学习你可能会挂科.mp3

title: 除了...以外 (chúle... yǐwài) - Apart from, besides
short_explanation: This phrase is used to indicate exception or exclusion, usually translated as 'apart from', 'besides', or 'except'.
long_explanation: The Mandarin Chinese expression '除了...以外 (chúle... yǐwài)' is primarily used in situations when we want to talk about exceptions or exclusions. In other words, it means that except for the person or thing mentioned, the statement remains true for all others.
formation: {除了 + exception + 以外}, [+ rest of sentence]

examples.cn: 除了跑步以外，我还喜欢游泳。
examples.pinyin: Chúle pǎobù yǐwài, wǒ hái xǐhuān yóuyǒng.
examples.en: Apart from running, I also like swimming.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_除了以外_chúle_yǐwài_-_Apart_from_besides_20231230_除了跑步以外我还喜欢游泳.mp3

examples.cn: 除了周末以外，他每天都在学习。
examples.pinyin: Chúle zhōumò yǐwài, tā měitiān dū zài xuéxí.
examples.en: Apart from weekends, he studies every day.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_除了以外_chúle_yǐwài_-_Apart_from_besides_20231230_除了周末以外他每天都在学习.mp3

examples.cn: 除了音乐以外，我对画画也非常感兴趣。
examples.pinyin: Chúle yīnyuè yǐwài, wǒ duì huà huà yě fēicháng gǎn xìngqù.
examples.en: Besides music, I am also very interested in painting.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_除了以外_chúle_yǐwài_-_Apart_from_besides_20231230_除了音乐以外我对画画也非常感兴趣.mp3

examples.cn: 除了数学和物理以外，他对所有科目都很擅长。
examples.pinyin: Chúle shùxué hé wùlǐ yǐwài, tā duì suǒyǒu kēmù dōu hěn shàncháng.
examples.en: Apart from mathematics and physics, he is good at all subjects.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_除了以外_chúle_yǐwài_-_Apart_from_besides_20231230_除了数学和物理以外他对所有科目都很擅长.mp3

title: 不仅...而且... (bùjǐn... érqiě...) - Not only... but also...
short_explanation: This is a compound conjunction used to show that besides the first point, there is also a second point.
long_explanation: The basic structure '不仅...而且...' in Mandarin Chinese serves to introduce not only one but two related aspects, events, or actions. It is similar to the English 'not only... but also...' The phrase emphasizes that both statements are true and might be relevant or surprising.
formation: Subject + 不仅 + Statement 1 + ，而且 + Statement 2.

examples.cn: 她不仅开朗，而且十分大方。
examples.pinyin: Tā bùjǐn kāilǎng, érqiě shífēn dàfāng.
examples.en: She is not only cheerful, but also very generous.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_不仅而且_bùjǐn_érqiě_-_Not_only_but_also_20231230_她不仅开朗而且十分大方.mp3

examples.cn: 我不仅喜欢吃中国菜，而且也喜欢学习如何烹饪这些菜。
examples.pinyin: Wǒ bùjǐn xǐhuan chī Zhōngguó cài, érqiě yě xǐhuan xuéxí rúhé pēngrèn zhèxiē cài.
examples.en: I not only enjoy eating Chinese food, but also love learning how to cook these dishes.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_不仅而且_bùjǐn_érqiě_-_Not_only_but_also_20231230_我不仅喜欢吃中国菜而且也喜欢学习如何烹饪这些菜.mp3

examples.cn: 这个城市不仅有美丽的风景，而且有浓厚的历史文化氛围。
examples.pinyin: Zhège chéngshì bùjǐn yǒu měilì de fēngjǐng, érqiě yǒu nónghòu de lìshǐ wénhuà fēnwéi.
examples.en: This city not only features beautiful scenery, but also has a rich historical and cultural atmosphere.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_不仅而且_bùjǐn_érqiě_-_Not_only_but_also_20231230_这个城市不仅有美丽的风景而且有浓厚的历史文化氛围.mp3

examples.cn: 他不仅会说普通话，而且会说五种不同的方言。
examples.pinyin: Tā bùjǐn huì shuō pǔtōnghuà, érqiě huì shuō wǔ zhǒng bùtóng de fāngyán.
examples.en: He not only speaks Mandarin, but also can speak five different dialects.

title: 何况 (hékuàng) - Let alone, not to mention
short_explanation: Used to express 'even more so' or 'not to mention'.
long_explanation: The Mandarin Chinese phrase '何况 (hékuàng)' is a conjunction used to indicate that the following statement or situation is even more true or applicable, given the truth of the preceding statement. In English, it is equivalent to phrases such as 'let alone', 'not to mention' or 'much less'. This phrase is typically known for showing a comparison by expressing something that is even more certain or extreme than what has previously been said.

examples.cn: 我连汉语的基本字都写不好，何况复杂的汉字。
examples.pinyin: Wǒ lián hànyǔ de jīběn zì dōu xiě bù hǎo, hékuàng fùzá de hànzì.
examples.en: I can't even write the basic Chinese characters well, let alone the complex ones.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_何况_hékuàng_-_Let_alone_not_to_mention_20231230_我连汉语的基本字都写不好何况复杂的汉字.mp3

examples.cn: 他连自己的工作都做不好，何况管理别人。
examples.pinyin: Tā lián zìjǐ de gōngzuò dū zuò bù hǎo , hékuàng guǎnlǐ biéren.
examples.en: He can't even do his own job well, let alone manage others.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_何况_hékuàng_-_Let_alone_not_to_mention_20231230_他连自己的工作都做不好何况管理别人.mp3

examples.cn: 她连基本的炒菜都不会，何况做复杂的菜肴。
examples.pinyin: Tā lián jīběn de chǎocài dū bù huì, hékuàng zuò fùzá de càiyáo.
examples.en: She can't even basic fry dishes, let alone make complicated cuisine.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_何况_hékuàng_-_Let_alone_not_to_mention_20231230_她连基本的炒菜都不会何况做复杂的菜肴.mp3

examples.cn: 他已经疲倦得连走路都觉得困难，何况跑步。
examples.pinyin: Tā yǐjīng píjuàn de lián zǒulù dōu juédé kùnnan, hékuàng pǎobù.
examples.en: He is already so tired that even walking feels difficult, let alone running.

title: 假使 (jiǎshǐ) - Supposing, if
short_explanation: Used to express hypothetical situations or conditions.
long_explanation: The Mandarin Chinese expression '假使 (jiǎshǐ)' is used to articulate hypothetical scenarios or conditions. It translates to 'supposing' or 'if' and is used to begin a supposition in the sentence. The structure is typically used to express 'if' in the hypothetical sense and is frequently employed in formal or written contexts.
formation: 假使 + Hypothetical situation / condition, then... (outcome)

examples.cn: 假使你中了彩票，你会做什么？我会买一所大房子。
examples.pinyin: Jiǎshǐ nǐ zhòng le cǎipiào, nǐ huì zuò shénme? Wǒ huì mǎi yī suǒ dà fángzi.
examples.en: If you won the lottery, what would you do? I would buy a big house.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_假使_jiǎshǐ_-_Supposing_if_20231230_假使你中了彩票你会做什么我会买一所大房子.mp3

examples.cn: 假使我有足够的时间，我会去看世界各地的风景。
examples.pinyin: Jiǎshǐ wǒ yǒu zúgòu de shíjiān, wǒ huì qù kàn shìjiè gèdì de fēngjǐng.
examples.en: If I had enough time, I would travel to see the world's various landscapes.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_假使_jiǎshǐ_-_Supposing_if_20231230_假使我有足够的时间我会去看世界各地的风景.mp3

examples.cn: 假使他明天来这里，你能不能接他？当然，我会去接他。
examples.pinyin: Jiǎshǐ tā míngtiān lái zhèlǐ, nǐ néng bùnéng jiē tā? Dāngrán, wǒ huì qù jiē tā.
examples.en: If he comes here tomorrow, could you pick him up? Of course, I will pick him up.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_假使_jiǎshǐ_-_Supposing_if_20231230_假使他明天来这里你能不能接他当然我会去接他.mp3

examples.cn: 假使我是你，我会选择去旅游。
examples.pinyin: Jiǎshǐ wǒ shì nǐ, wǒ huì xuǎnzé qù lǚyóu.
examples.en: If I were you, I would choose to go on a trip.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_假使_jiǎshǐ_-_Supposing_if_20231230_假使我是你我会选择去旅游.mp3

title: 倘若 (tǎngruò) - If, supposing
short_explanation: An expression used to indicate a hypothetical condition.
long_explanation: The phrase '倘若 (tǎngruò)' is used in Mandarin Chinese to express 'if' or 'supposing,' akin to an 'if' clause in English. It introduces a hypothesized event, condition or situation. The event following '倘若' is the assumed or hypothetical situation, and the event following is the consequent outcome of that hypothetical scenario.

examples.cn: 倘若明天不下雨，我们就去爬山。
examples.pinyin: Tǎngruò míngtiān bù xià yǔ, wǒmen jiù qù páshān.
examples.en: If it does not rain tomorrow, we will go mountain climbing.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_倘若_tǎngruò_-_If_supposing_20231230_倘若明天不下雨我们就去爬山.mp3

examples.cn: 倘若我有足够的钱，我会去旅行。
examples.pinyin: Tǎngruò wǒ yǒu zúgòu de qián, wǒ huì qù lǚxíng.
examples.en: If I have enough money, I will go traveling.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_倘若_tǎngruò_-_If_supposing_20231230_倘若我有足够的钱我会去旅行.mp3

examples.cn: 倘若他得知这个消息，他肯定会很高兴。
examples.pinyin: Tǎngruò tā dézhī zhège xiāoxi, tā kěndìng huì hěn gāoxìng.
examples.en: If he finds out this news, he will definitely be happy.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_倘若_tǎngruò_-_If_supposing_20231230_倘若他得知这个消息他肯定会很高兴.mp3

examples.cn: 倘若你需要帮助，随时向我求助。
examples.pinyin: Tǎngruò nǐ xūyào bāngzhù, suíshí xiàng wǒ qiúzhù.
examples.en: If you need help, you can ask me at any time.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_倘若_tǎngruò_-_If_supposing_20231230_倘若你需要帮助随时向我求助.mp3

title: 正如 (zhèngrú) - Just as, as
short_explanation: 正如 (zhèngrú) is used to indicate that one situation or fact is similar to or the same as another.
long_explanation: The phrase '正如 (zhèngrú)' in Mandarin Chinese is employed to draw a comparison between two situations, facts, or things, suggesting a similarity or parallelism between them. This phrase is similar to 'just as' or 'as' in English. It is commonly used to highlight the likeness or equivalence between two aspects or points of consideration.

examples.cn: 正如你所看到的，我现在非常忙。
examples.pinyin: Zhèngrú nǐ suǒ kàndào de, wǒ xiànzài fēicháng máng.
examples.en: Just as you can see, I am very busy right now.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_正如_zhèngrú_-_Just_as_as_20231230_正如你所看到的我现在非常忙.mp3

examples.cn: 他的专业知识非常丰富，正如我之前告诉你的那样。
examples.pinyin: Tā de zhuānyè zhīshì fēicháng fēngfù, zhèngrú wǒ zhīqián gàosù nǐ de nà yàng.
examples.en: His professional knowledge is very rich, just as I told you before.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_正如_zhèngrú_-_Just_as_as_20231230_他的专业知识非常丰富正如我之前告诉你的那样.mp3

examples.cn: 正如我所预料的，他没有按时完成任务。
examples.pinyin: Zhèngrú wǒ suǒ yùliào de, tā méiyǒu àn shí wánchéng rènwù.
examples.en: Just as I expected, he did not complete the task on time.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_正如_zhèngrú_-_Just_as_as_20231230_正如我所预料的他没有按时完成任务.mp3

examples.cn: 正如我了解的，他是个非常有天赋的艺术家。
examples.pinyin: Zhèngrú wǒ liǎojiě de, tā shì gè fēicháng yǒu tiānfù de yìshùjiā.
examples.en: As I understand, he is a very talented artist.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_正如_zhèngrú_-_Just_as_as_20231230_正如我了解的他是个非常有天赋的艺术家.mp3

title: 正因为...所以... (zhèng yīnwèi... suǒyǐ...) - Precisely because... therefore...
short_explanation: Used to express the relationship of cause and effect between two sentences.
long_explanation: The Mandarin Chinese phrase '正因为...所以...' is a structure used to show the cause and effect relationship between two situations or events. It can be translated as 'precisely because... therefore...' in English. The sentence pattern begins with '正因为' (precisely because) to state the cause, followed by '所以' (therefore) to indicate the effect.
formation: 正因为 + Cause, 所以 + Effect

examples.cn: 正因为他每天努力学习，所以他的成绩一直很好。
examples.pinyin: Zhèng yīnwèi tā měitiān nǔlì xuéxí, suǒyǐ tā de chéngjī yīzhí hěn hǎo.
examples.en: Precisely because he studies hard every day, therefore his grades have always been good.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_正因为所以_zhèng_yīnwèi_suǒyǐ_-_Precisely_because_therefore_20231230_正因为他每天努力学习所以他的成绩一直很好.mp3

examples.cn: 正因为他不怕困难，所以他能够完成这个任务。
examples.pinyin: Zhèng yīnwèi tā bù pà kùnnan, suǒyǐ tā nénggòu wánchéng zhège rènwù.
examples.en: Precisely because he is not afraid of difficulties, therefore he can complete this task.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_正因为所以_zhèng_yīnwèi_suǒyǐ_-_Precisely_because_therefore_20231230_正因为他不怕困难所以他能够完成这个任务.mp3

examples.cn: 正因为你善良，所以大家都喜欢你。
examples.pinyin: Zhèng yīnwèi nǐ shànliáng, suǒyǐ dàjiā dōu xǐhuān nǐ.
examples.en: Precisely because you are kind, therefore everyone likes you.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_正因为所以_zhèng_yīnwèi_suǒyǐ_-_Precisely_because_therefore_20231230_正因为你善良所以大家都喜欢你.mp3

examples.cn: 正因为我爱吃中国菜，所以我学会了做饭。
examples.pinyin: Zhèng yīnwèi wǒ ài chī zhōngguó cài, suǒyǐ wǒ xuéhuì le zuò fàn.
examples.en: Precisely because I love Chinese food, therefore I learned to cook.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_正因为所以_zhèng_yīnwèi_suǒyǐ_-_Precisely_because_therefore_20231230_正因为我爱吃中国菜所以我学会了做饭.mp3

title: 而非 (érfēi) - Rather than
short_explanation: Used to express preference or selection between two options or to correct a mistaken identity or clarification.
long_explanation: The Mandarin Chinese phrase '而非 (érfēi)' is a conjunction commonly used to indicate a preference or choice between two options, or to correct a mistaken identity or statement. It is equivalent to 'rather than' in English. With this phrase, you can emphasize that one thing is true or appropriate instead of another.
formation: Item A + 而非 + Item B

examples.cn: 他是一个教师而非学生。
examples.pinyin: Tā shì yīgè jiàoshī érfēi xuéshēng.
examples.en: He is a teacher rather than a student.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_而非_érfēi_-_Rather_than_20231230_他是一个教师而非学生.mp3

examples.cn: 我们应该以事实为依据而非假设。
examples.pinyin: Wǒmen yīnggāi yǐ shìshí wéi yījù érfēi jiǎshè.
examples.en: We should base on facts rather than assumptions.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_而非_érfēi_-_Rather_than_20231230_我们应该以事实为依据而非假设.mp3

examples.cn: 我更喜欢用电子邮件而非传统的信件方式来沟通。
examples.pinyin: Wǒ gèng xǐhuān yòng diànzǐ yóujiàn érfēi chuántǒng de xìnjiàn fāngshì lái gōutōng.
examples.en: I prefer to communicate by email rather than traditional letters.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_而非_érfēi_-_Rather_than_20231230_我更喜欢用电子邮件而非传统的信件方式来沟通.mp3

examples.cn: 他们选择走路去公园，而非乘坐公共汽车。
examples.pinyin: Tāmen xuǎnzé zǒulù qù gōngyuán, érfēi chéngzuò gōnggòng qìchē.
examples.en: They chose to walk to the park rather than take the bus.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_而非_érfēi_-_Rather_than_20231230_他们选择走路去公园而非乘坐公共汽车.mp3

title: 若是 (ruòshì) - If, in case
short_explanation: Used to express a conditional or hypothetical situation.
long_explanation: The Mandarin Chinese conjunction '若是 (ruòshì)' is equivalent to the English 'if' or 'in case'. It introduces a hypothetical condition or situation, which is usually followed by a possible outcome or consequence.

examples.cn: 若是你感觉不舒服，就早点回家休息吧。
examples.pinyin: Ruòshì nǐ gǎnjué bù shūfú, jiù zǎodiǎn huíjiā xiūxí ba.
examples.en: If you're not feeling well, go home and rest early.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_若是_ruòshì_-_If_in_case_20231230_若是你感觉不舒服就早点回家休息吧.mp3

examples.cn: 若是你明天空闲，我们可以去看电影。

examples.en: If you are free tomorrow, we can go watch a movie.

title: 鉴于 (jiànyú) - In light of, considering
short_explanation: Used in Mandarin to express a cause or reason that calls for a certain action or result.
long_explanation: The Mandarin Chinese phrase '鉴于 (jiànyú)' is commonly used to introduce a reason or cause that prompts a particular action or result. The phrase is similar in context to English expressions like 'in light of' or 'considering'. It indicates a basis for the action stated in the consequent clause.

examples.cn: 鉴于他的努力和才华，我们决定提升他为经理。
examples.pinyin: Jiànyú tā de nǔlì hé cáihuá, wǒmen juédìng tíshēng tā wéi jīnglǐ.
examples.en: In light of his effort and talent, we have decided to promote him to manager.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_鉴于_jiànyú_-_In_light_of_considering_20231230_鉴于他的努力和才华我们决定提升他为经理.mp3

examples.cn: 鉴于你已经完成了全部课程，你可以申请毕业了。
examples.pinyin: Jiànyú nǐ yǐjīng wánchéng le quánbù kèchéng, nǐ kěyǐ shēnqǐng bìyè le.
examples.en: Considering you have completed all the courses, you can apply for graduation.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_鉴于_jiànyú_-_In_light_of_considering_20231230_鉴于你已经完成了全部课程你可以申请毕业了.mp3

examples.cn: 鉴于天气预报表示今天会下雨，我们决定取消今天的野餐。
examples.pinyin: Jiànyú tiānqì yùbào biǎoshì jīntiān huì xià yǔ, wǒmen juédìng qǔxiāo jīntiān de yěcān.
examples.en: In light of the weather forecast suggesting it will rain today, we decided to cancel the picnic.

examples.cn: 鉴于他的年龄和健康状况，他不太可能出任这个职位。

examples.en: Considering his age and health condition, it's unlikely that he will take up this position.

title: 尽可能 (jǐn kěnéng) - As much as possible
short_explanation: Used to express 'as much as possible' or 'to the best one can'.
long_explanation: The Mandarin Chinese phrase '尽可能 (jǐn kěnéng)' is used to indicate trying to achieve something to the greatest extent possible, or doing something to the best of one's ability. It is equivalent to saying 'as much as possible' or 'as well as possible' in English. This phrase can be used with verbs, adjectives, and nouns to express the idea of maximising one's effort or optimising a situation.

examples.cn: 我会尽可能地帮你准备汉语水平考试。
examples.pinyin: Wǒ huì jǐn kěnéng de bāng nǐ zhǔnbèi hànyǔ shuǐpíng kǎoshì.
examples.en: I will help you to prepare for the Chinese proficiency test as much as possible.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_尽可能_jǐn_kěnéng_-_As_much_as_possible_20231230_我会尽可能地帮你准备汉语水平考试.mp3

examples.cn: 请你尽可能快地走，否则我们会迟到的。
examples.pinyin: Qǐng nǐ jǐn kěnéng kuài de zǒu, fǒuzé wǒmen huì chídào de.
examples.en: Please walk as fast as possible, otherwise we will be late.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_尽可能_jǐn_kěnéng_-_As_much_as_possible_20231230_请你尽可能快地走否则我们会迟到的.mp3

examples.cn: 他尽可能地吃了很多水果来保持健康。
examples.pinyin: Tā jǐn kěnéng de chīle hěnduō shuǐguǒ lái bǎochí jiànkāng.
examples.en: He has eaten as many fruits as possible to stay healthy.

examples.cn: 我们应该尽可能地利用我们的时间。

title: 并非 (bìngfēi) - Not at all, is not
short_explanation: Used to express the negation of a fact or a statement.
long_explanation: The Mandarin Chinese phrase '并非 (bìngfēi)' is used to deny a situation or fact. It refers to something that is not the case or untrue, essentially denoting the opposite of what may initially appear to be true. Unlike the basic negative 不 (bù), '并非 (bìngfēi)' is stronger in tone and usually used in written Chinese or formal contexts.

examples.cn: 他并非我最好的朋友，但我们很长时间都在一起。
examples.pinyin: Tā bìngfēi wǒ zuì hǎo de péngyǒu, dàn wǒmen hěn cháng shíjiān dōu zài yīqǐ.
examples.en: He is not at all my best friend, but we have been together for a long time.

examples.cn: 这个问题并非一朝一夕就能解决的。

examples.en: This problem is not something that can be solved overnight.

examples.cn: 他并非没有心，他只是沉默不语。

examples.en: It's not that he doesn't care, he just remains silent.

examples.en: It's not that I don't want to go, it's just that I don't have the time.

title: 无论...都... (wúlùn... dōu...) - No matter...always...
short_explanation: This pattern is used to express 'no matter what/who/how etc...always...'.
long_explanation: The Mandarin Chinese phrase '无论...都... (wúlùn... dōu...)' is used to indicate that the action or situation expressed in the main clause happens or is true regardless of the different conditions or possibilities expressed in the subordinate clause. It is equivalent to the English pattern 'no matter (what/who/how)...always...'.

examples.cn: 无论多么困难，我们都不应放弃。
examples.pinyin: Wúlùn duōme kùnnan, wǒmen dōu bù yīng fàngqì.
examples.en: No matter how difficult it is, we should never give up.

examples.en: No matter where you go, he will always find you.

title: 不然 (bùrán) - Otherwise, or else
short_explanation: Used to indicate the consequence if the action or condition in the first part of the sentence does not happen or is not met.
long_explanation: The Mandarin Chinese phrase '不然 (bùrán)' is utilized to signify the repercussions that might occur if a preceding action or condition is not accomplished or fulfilled. In English, it is similar to saying 'otherwise', or 'or else', suggesting a negative outcome that is to be avoided.

examples.cn: 你应该早点睡觉，不然明天你会感觉累。

title: 趁 (chèn) - While, take advantage of

long_explanation: In Mandarin Chinese, '趁 (chèn)' is a preposition used to describe an action or activity performed while taking advantage of a certain time or situation. This is usually used when the condition or situation is favorable or timely for carrying out a particular action. It's equivalent to English expressions 'while' or 'take advantage of'.

examples.cn: 趁天气还好，我们应该出去散步。

title: 无非 (wúfēi) - Nothing but, only
short_explanation: Used to emphasize that a situation or thing is really quite simple or only involves very few elements.
long_explanation: The phrase '无非 (wúfēi)' in Mandarin Chinese is used to emphasize that something is simple, or only involves certain elements or aspects. It is equivalent to 'nothing but' or 'only' in English. This phrase is often used to downplay the complexity of a situation or to emphasize the simplicity of a matter.
formation: 无非 + Verb/Adjective + Rest of the sentence

examples.cn: 他无非是想让你理解他的立场。

title: 除非 (chúfēi) - Only if, unless

long_explanation: The Mandarin Chinese phrase '除非 (chúfēi)' is used to indicate that a specific circumstance is the only scenario in which a certain result will occur, it is equivalent to saying 'only if' or 'unless' in English. This phrase is typically used to bring attention to the one requirement or prerequisite that must be satisfied for a certain outcome to happen.

examples.pinyin: Míngtiān wúlùn rúhé wǒ dōu bìxū qù Běijīng.
examples.en: No matter what, I have to go to Beijing tomorrow.

title: 只怕 (zhǐpà) - I'm afraid that, perhaps
short_explanation: Only afraid (zhǐpà) is used to express the possibility of an undesirable situation.
long_explanation: 只怕 (zhǐpà) is a conjunction often used in Mandarin Chinese to introduce a clause that expresses a worry or fear about a possible situation or event. It can be translated to 'I'm afraid that' or 'perhaps' in English, reflecting hesitation or uncertainty. It should follow a subject and precede a verb or an adjective.
formation: Subject + 只怕 + Verb or Adjective + Rest of the sentence

examples.cn: 我只怕他们会在你身上取笑。
examples.pinyin: Wǒ zhǐpà tāmen huì zài nǐ shēnshang qǔxiào.
examples.en: I'm afraid they might mock you.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_只怕_zhǐpà_-_Im_afraid_that_perhaps_20231230_我只怕他们会在你身上取笑.mp3

examples.cn: 只怕明天下雨，我们的野餐就得取消。
examples.pinyin: Zhǐpà míngtiān xià yǔ, wǒmen de yěcān jiù děi qǔxiāo.
examples.en: I'm afraid that if it rains tomorrow, we'll have to cancel our picnic.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_只怕_zhǐpà_-_Im_afraid_that_perhaps_20231230_只怕明天下雨我们的野餐就得取消.mp3

examples.cn: 我只怕没做好准备的学生会找不到合适的工作。
examples.pinyin: Wǒ zhǐpà méi zuò hǎo zhǔnbèi de xuéshēng huì zhǎobudào héshì de gōngzuò.
examples.en: I'm afraid that unprepared students might struggle to find suitable jobs.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_只怕_zhǐpà_-_Im_afraid_that_perhaps_20231230_我只怕没做好准备的学生会找不到合适的工作.mp3

examples.cn: 这个房子很漂亮，只怕价格太高了。
examples.pinyin: Zhè ge fángzi hěn piàoliang, zhǐpà jiàgé tài gāo le.
examples.en: This house is very nice, I'm afraid that the price might be too high.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_只怕_zhǐpà_-_Im_afraid_that_perhaps_20231230_这个房子很漂亮只怕价格太高了.mp3

title: 尽管如此 (jǐnguǎn rúcǐ) - Even so, nonetheless
short_explanation: Used to express contrast or concession, similar to 'even so' or 'nonetheless' in English.
long_explanation: 尽管如此 (jǐnguǎn rúcǐ) is a conjunction used in Mandarin Chinese to express contrast, specifically a situation that departs from an expectation or norm previously mentioned. Normally used in formal or written Chinese, it's commonly translated into English as 'even so' or 'nonetheless'. It helps to highlight a point of contradiction or concession that exists despite a previously stated fact.
formation: Statement 1 + 尽管如此 + statement of contrast

examples.cn: 他的工作非常繁忙，尽管如此，他总是找时间与家人在一起。
examples.pinyin: Tā de gōngzuò fēicháng fánmáng, jǐnguǎn rúcǐ, tā zǒng shì zhǎo shíjiān yǔ jiārén zài yīqǐ.
examples.en: His job is very busy, even so, he always finds time to be with his family.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_尽管如此_jǐnguǎn_rúcǐ_-_Even_so_nonetheless_20231230_他的工作非常繁忙尽管如此他总是找时间与家人在一起.mp3

examples.cn: 这部电影的结局并不是我喜欢的类型，尽管如此，我还是感到非常触动。
examples.pinyin: Zhè bù diànyǐng de jiéjú bìng bùshì wǒ xǐhuan de lèixíng, jǐnguǎn rúcǐ, wǒ háishì gǎndào fēicháng chùdòng.
examples.en: The ending of this movie isn't the type I like, nonetheless, I was very moved.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_尽管如此_jǐnguǎn_rúcǐ_-_Even_so_nonetheless_20231230_这部电影的结局并不是我喜欢的类型尽管如此我还是感到非常触动.mp3

examples.cn: 尽管如此，我对我能成功还是非常有信心。
examples.pinyin: Jǐnguǎn rúcǐ, wǒ duì wǒ néng chénggōng háishì fēicháng yǒu xìnxīn.
examples.en: Nonetheless, I still have great confidence that I can succeed.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_尽管如此_jǐnguǎn_rúcǐ_-_Even_so_nonetheless_20231230_尽管如此我对我能成功还是非常有信心.mp3

examples.cn: 看上去要下大雨了，尽管如此，他还是决定骑自行车出门。
examples.pinyin: Kàn shàngqu yào xià dà yǔ le, jǐnguǎn rúcǐ, tā hái shì juédìng qí zìxíngchē chūmén.
examples.en: It looks like it's going to rain heavily, even so, he still decided to go out on his bike.

title: 难怪 (nánguài) - No wonder, so that's why
short_explanation: Used to express realization of a previously unknown cause of a situation.
long_explanation: The Mandarin Chinese phrase '难怪 (nánguài)' is used to express a sudden realization or understanding about the reason or cause of a certain situation. It can be used in the beginning or end of a sentence, and translates to 'no wonder' or 'so that's why' in English.
formation: 难怪 + Sentence OR Sentence + 难怪

examples.cn: 今天你表现得很奇怪，难怪，昨天晚上你根本没睡觉。
examples.pinyin: Jīntiān nǐ biǎoxiàn dé hěn qíguài, nánguài, zuótiān wǎnshàng nǐ gēnběn méi shuìjiào.
examples.en: You are behaving very strangely today, no wonder, you didn't sleep at all last night.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_难怪_nánguài_-_No_wonder_so_thats_why_20231230_今天你表现得很奇怪难怪昨天晚上你根本没睡觉.mp3

examples.cn: 这本书真的非常好看，难怪你推荐我买。
examples.pinyin: Zhè běn shū zhēn de fēicháng hǎo kàn, nánguài nǐ tuījiàn wǒ mǎi.
examples.en: This book is really good, no wonder you recommended me to buy it.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_难怪_nánguài_-_No_wonder_so_thats_why_20231230_这本书真的非常好看难怪你推荐我买.mp3

examples.cn: 难怪你写中文那么好，你在北京住了五年。
examples.pinyin: Nánguài nǐ xiě Zhōngwén nàme hǎo, nǐ zài Běijīng zhù le wǔ nián.
examples.en: No wonder your Chinese writing is so good, you've lived in Beijing for five years.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_难怪_nánguài_-_No_wonder_so_thats_why_20231230_难怪你写中文那么好你在北京住了五年.mp3

examples.cn: 难怪天这么冷，原来冬天已经来了。
examples.pinyin: Nánguài tiān zhème lěng, yuánlái dōngtiān yǐjīng lái le.
examples.en: No wonder it's so cold, it turns out that winter is here.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_难怪_nánguài_-_No_wonder_so_thats_why_20231230_难怪天这么冷原来冬天已经来了.mp3

title: 尽早 (jǐnzǎo) - As early as possible
short_explanation: Used to express the need to do something as early as possible.
long_explanation: The Mandarin Chinese phrase '尽早 (jǐnzǎo)' implies a sense of urgency and is used when something needs to be done as soon as possible, or 'at the earliest convenience'. It holds the similar meaning as 'as soon as possible' or 'at your earliest convenience' in English. The use of '尽早' can make a sentence sound more polite, formal and businesslike.

examples.cn: 请尽早完成这个项目，以便我们可以提早开始下一个。
examples.pinyin: Qǐng jǐnzǎo wánchéng zhège xiàngmù, yǐbiàn wǒmen kěyǐ tízǎo kāishǐ xià yīgè.
examples.en: Please complete this project as early as possible so that we can start the next one earlier.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_尽早_jǐnzǎo_-_As_early_as_possible_20231230_请尽早完成这个项目以便我们可以提早开始下一个.mp3

examples.cn: 尽早支付您的账单，以避免任何可能的延误。
examples.pinyin: Jǐnzǎo zhīfù nín de zhàngdān, yǐ bìmiǎn rènhé kěnéng de yánwù.
examples.en: Pay your bill as early as possible to avoid any possible delay.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_尽早_jǐnzǎo_-_As_early_as_possible_20231230_尽早支付您的账单以避免任何可能的延误.mp3

examples.cn: 我会尽早将这个信息告诉他。
examples.pinyin: Wǒ huì jǐnzǎo jiāng zhège xìnxī gàosù tā.
examples.en: I will tell him this information as early as possible.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_尽早_jǐnzǎo_-_As_early_as_possible_20231230_我会尽早将这个信息告诉他.mp3

examples.cn: 请尽早回复这封电子邮件。
examples.pinyin: Qǐng jǐnzǎo huífù zhè fēng diànzǐ yóujiàn.
examples.en: Please reply to this email as early as possible.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_尽早_jǐnzǎo_-_As_early_as_possible_20231230_请尽早回复这封电子邮件.mp3

title: 一旦 (yīdàn) - Once, in case (something happens)
short_explanation: Used to express a hypothetical condition, often indicative of a change or turning point.
long_explanation: The Mandarin Chinese term '一旦 (yīdàn)' is a conjunction that sets a condition, under which something will happen or a situation will change. It is equivalent to saying 'once' or 'in case' in English. This word is typically used in formal or written Chinese to express potential major changes or turning points.
formation: 一旦 + situation or condition, the rest of the sentence determines the outcome.

examples.cn: 一旦失去健康，你将意识到它的重要性。
examples.pinyin: Yīdàn shīqù jiànkāng, nǐ jiāng yìshí dào tā de zhòngyàoxìng.
examples.en: Once you lose your health, you will realize its importance.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_一旦_yīdàn_-_Once_in_case_something_happens_20231230_一旦失去健康你将意识到它的重要性.mp3

examples.cn: 一旦发生火灾，你必须立即离开建筑物。
examples.pinyin: Yīdàn fāshēng huǒzhài, nǐ bìxū lìjí líkāi jiànzhúwù.
examples.en: In case of a fire, you must leave the building immediately.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_一旦_yīdàn_-_Once_in_case_something_happens_20231230_一旦发生火灾你必须立即离开建筑物.mp3

examples.cn: 一旦你确定了目标，就要全力以赴实现它。
examples.pinyin: Yīdàn nǐ quèdìngle mùbiāo, jiù yào quánlì yǐfù shíxiàn tā.
examples.en: Once you have set a goal, you have to do your utmost to achieve it.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_一旦_yīdàn_-_Once_in_case_something_happens_20231230_一旦你确定了目标就要全力以赴实现它.mp3

examples.cn: 一旦我们做出决定，我们就不能轻易改变。
examples.pinyin: Yīdàn wǒmen zuò chū juédìng, wǒmen jiù bùnéng qīngyì gǎibiàn.
examples.en: Once we make a decision, we cannot change it easily.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_一旦_yīdàn_-_Once_in_case_something_happens_20231230_一旦我们做出决定我们就不能轻易改变.mp3

title: 虽说 (suī shuō) - Although, though
short_explanation: Used to introduce a concession or acknowledgment in a logical argument or statement.
long_explanation: The Mandarin Chinese connective phrase '虽说 (suī shuō)' is an expression used to demonstrate a concession, contradiction or opposition in a statement or argument. It is equivalent to saying 'although' or 'though' in English. This phrase often precedes an acknowledged fact or argument, yet introduces a contrasting view or outcome in the latter part of the sentence.

examples.cn: 虽说他常常迟到，但是他的工作成绩总是很好。
examples.pinyin: Suī shuō tā chángcháng chídào, dànshì tā de gōngzuò chéngjì zǒngshì hěn hǎo.
examples.en: Although he often arrives late, his work performance is always good.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_虽说_suī_shuō_-_Although_though_20231230_虽说他常常迟到但是他的工作成绩总是很好.mp3

examples.cn: 虽说我不喜欢吃辣，我还是会尝试一下四川菜。
examples.pinyin: Suī shuō wǒ bù xǐhuān chī là, wǒ háishì huì chángshì yīxià Sìchuān cài.
examples.en: Although I don't like spicy food, I will still try Sichuan cuisine.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_虽说_suī_shuō_-_Although_though_20231230_虽说我不喜欢吃辣我还是会尝试一下四川菜.mp3

examples.cn: 虽说这份工作很有压力，我还是决定接受。
examples.pinyin: Suī shuō zhè fèn gōngzuò hěn yǒu yālì, wǒ háishì juédìng jiēshòu.
examples.en: Although this job is very stressful, I still decided to accept it.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_虽说_suī_shuō_-_Although_though_20231230_虽说这份工作很有压力我还是决定接受.mp3

examples.cn: 虽说他们的产品质量好，我还是不打算购买。
examples.pinyin: Suī shuō tāmen de chǎnpǐn zhìliàng hǎo, wǒ háishì bù dǎsuàn gòumǎi.
examples.en: Although their product quality is good, I still do not plan to buy.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_虽说_suī_shuō_-_Although_though_20231230_虽说他们的产品质量好我还是不打算购买.mp3

title: 不得不 (bùdébù) - Have to, can't avoid
short_explanation: Used to express strong obligation or necessity.
long_explanation: In Mandarin Chinese, '不得不 (bùdébù)' is used to convey a strong obligation or necessity. It is equivalent to saying 'have to' or 'can't avoid' in English. This phrase is used to describe a situation where someone is compelled to do something, often due to circumstances beyond their control.

examples.cn: 因为下雨，我不得不取消了我们的户外旅行。
examples.pinyin: Yīnwèi xià yǔ, wǒ bùdébù qǔxiāo le wǒmen de hùwài lǚxíng.
examples.en: Because of the rain, I had to cancel our outdoor trip.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_不得不_bùdébù_-_Have_to_cant_avoid_20231230_因为下雨我不得不取消了我们的户外旅行.mp3

examples.cn: 不得不承认，他的这个在工作上的表现比我出色。
examples.pinyin: Bùdébù chéngrèn, tā de zhège zài gōngzuò shàng de biǎoxiàn bǐ wǒ chūsè.
examples.en: I have to admit, his performance at work is better than mine.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_不得不_bùdébù_-_Have_to_cant_avoid_20231230_不得不承认他的这个在工作上的表现比我出色.mp3

examples.cn: 尽管我不愿意，但我不得不接受他的决定。
examples.pinyin: Jǐnguǎn wǒ bù yuànyì, dàn wǒ bùdébù jiēshòu tā de juédìng.
examples.en: Although I don't want to, I have to accept his decision.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_不得不_bùdébù_-_Have_to_cant_avoid_20231230_尽管我不愿意但我不得不接受他的决定.mp3

examples.cn: 孩子生病了，我不得不留在家里照顾他们。
examples.pinyin: Háizǐ shēngbìng le, wǒ bùdébù liú zài jiā lǐ zhàogù tāmen.
examples.en: The kids are sick, I have to stay at home to take care of them.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_不得不_bùdébù_-_Have_to_cant_avoid_20231230_孩子生病了我不得不留在家里照顾他们.mp3

title: 难道 (nándào) - Could it be that, isn't it the case?
short_explanation: Used to pose a rhetorical question, expressing surprise or doubt.
long_explanation: 难道 (nándào) is a Mandarin Chinese interrogative adverb used to express doubt or surprise in a rhetorical question. It is often translated as 'Could it be that?' or 'Isn't it the case?' in English. It does not require a response since the speaker does not anticipate an answer.

examples.cn: 难道你真的不知道熊猫是中国的国宝吗？我真的感到惊讶。
examples.pinyin: Nándào nǐ zhēndé bù zhīdào xióngmāo shì Zhōngguó de guóbǎo ma? Wǒ zhēndé gǎndào jīngyà.
examples.en: Could it be that you really don't know pandas are the Chinese national treasure? I'm really surprised.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_难道_nándào_-_Could_it_be_that_isnt_it_the_case_20231230_难道你真的不知道熊猫是中国的国宝吗我真的感到惊讶.mp3

examples.cn: 难道你还没完成家庭作业吗？我们已经有足够的时间来完成它了。
examples.pinyin: Nándào nǐ hái méi wánchéng jiātíng zuòyè ma? Wǒmen yǐjīng yǒu zúgòu de shíjiān lái wánchéng tāle.
examples.en: Could it be that you haven't finished the homework yet? We already had enough time to finish it.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_难道_nándào_-_Could_it_be_that_isnt_it_the_case_20231230_难道你还没完成家庭作业吗我们已经有足够的时间来完成它了.mp3

examples.cn: 难道这就是你的最好的解决方案吗？我期待更多。
examples.pinyin: Nándào zhè jiùshì nǐ de zuì hǎo de jiějué fāng'àn ma? Wǒ qídài gèng duō.
examples.en: Could this really be your best solution? I was hoping for more.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_难道_nándào_-_Could_it_be_that_isnt_it_the_case_20231230_难道这就是你的最好的解决方案吗我期待更多.mp3

examples.cn: 难道你不喜欢这件衬衫吗？我本以为你会喜欢的。
examples.pinyin: Nándào nǐ bù xǐhuān zhè jiàn chènshān ma? Wǒ běn yǐwéi nǐ huì xǐhuān de.
examples.en: Could it be that you don't like this shirt? I thought you would.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_难道_nándào_-_Could_it_be_that_isnt_it_the_case_20231230_难道你不喜欢这件衬衫吗我本以为你会喜欢的.mp3

title: 一直 (yīzhí) - All along, continuously
short_explanation: Used to describe continuous or unbroken action or state.
long_explanation: '一直 (yīzhí)' in Mandarin Chinese conveys a sense of continuity or an unbroken state of affairs. Comparable to the English expressions 'all along' or 'continuously', this term denotes that an action or condition has been ongoing for a period of time, without interruption. It can be employed to describe both actions and states, emphasizing that they continue unabated from the past to the future.

examples.cn: 我一直在等你，你怎么现在才来？
examples.pinyin: Wǒ yīzhí zài děng nǐ, nǐ zěnme xiànzài cái lái?
examples.en: I've been waiting for you all along, why are you only coming now?
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_一直_yīzhí_-_All_along_continuously_20231230_我一直在等你你怎么现在才来.mp3

examples.cn: 他一直在工作，没有休息。
examples.pinyin: Tā yīzhí zài gōngzuò, méiyǒu xiūxí.
examples.en: He's been working continuously, without any rest.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_一直_yīzhí_-_All_along_continuously_20231230_他一直在工作没有休息.mp3

examples.cn: 她一直想要去看那部电影，但是还没机会。
examples.pinyin: Tā yīzhí xiǎng yào qù kàn nà bù diànyǐng, dànshì hái méi jīhuì.
examples.en: She's wanted to see that movie all along, but still hasn't had the chance.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_一直_yīzhí_-_All_along_continuously_20231230_她一直想要去看那部电影但是还没机会.mp3

examples.cn: 我一直都住在这个城市，从来没有搬过家。
examples.pinyin: Wǒ yīzhí dōu zhù zài zhège chéngshì, cónglái méiyǒu bānguò jiā.
examples.en: I've lived in this city continuously, never having moved houses.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_一直_yīzhí_-_All_along_continuously_20231230_我一直都住在这个城市从来没有搬过家.mp3

title: 终于 (zhōngyú) - Finally, At Last
short_explanation: Used to express something that has happened after a long wait or many difficulties.
long_explanation: The Mandarin Chinese word '终于 (zhōngyú)' is used to express the idea that something has finally occurred after a long period of waiting, or after overcoming many obstacles or challenges. It can be likened to the English words 'finally' or 'at last'. It usually conveys a sense of relief, accomplishment, or even surprise.
formation: Subject + Time + 终于 + Verb + Result

examples.cn: 经过一天的忙碌，我终于完成了这个项目。
examples.pinyin: Jīngguò yītiān de mánglù, wǒ zhōngyú wánchéng le zhège xiàngmù.
examples.en: After a busy day, I finally completed the project.
