examples.cn: 等了这么久，火车终于到了。
examples.pinyin: Děngle zhème jiǔ, huǒchē zhōngyú dào le.
examples.en: After such a long wait, the train has finally arrived.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_终于_zhōngyú_-_Finally_At_Last_20231230_等了这么久火车终于到了.mp3

examples.cn: 我终于明白了为什么他那么开心了，他升职了。
examples.pinyin: Wǒ zhōngyú míngbái le wèishéme tā nàme kāixīn le, tā shēngzhí le.
examples.en: I finally understand why he's so happy, he got a promotion.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_终于_zhōngyú_-_Finally_At_Last_20231230_我终于明白了为什么他那么开心了他升职了.mp3

examples.cn: 经过半年的努力，我终于通过了汉语水平考试。
examples.pinyin: Jīngguò bàn nián de nǔlì, wǒ zhōngyú tōngguòle Hànyǔ shuǐpíng kǎoshì.
examples.en: After six months of effort, I finally passed the Chinese proficiency test.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_终于_zhōngyú_-_Finally_At_Last_20231230_经过半年的努力我终于通过了汉语水平考试.mp3

title: 早已 (zǎoyǐ) - Long ago, for a long time
short_explanation: Used to refer to actions that have happened a long time ago or for a long time.
long_explanation: The Mandarin Chinese phrase '早已 (zǎoyǐ)' is utilized to indicate that an event or an action has occurred some time ago, or has been happening for a prolonged time. It provides a strong sense of past time, and emphasizes the length of time that has passed since the action has taken place. This is similar to the English phrase 'long ago' or 'for a long time'.
formation: Subject + 早已 + Verb + Rest of the Sentence

examples.cn: 我早已注意到你的努力，你的付出我会记在心里的。
examples.pinyin: Wǒ zǎoyǐ zhùyì dào nǐ de nǔlì, nǐ de fùchū wǒ huì jì zài xīnlǐ de.
examples.en: I noticed your efforts long ago, and I will remember your efforts.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_早已_zǎoyǐ_-_Long_ago_for_a_long_time_20231230_我早已注意到你的努力你的付出我会记在心里的.mp3

examples.cn: 他这部作品我早已读过，而且我觉得它非常引人入胜。
examples.pinyin: Tā zhè bù zuòpǐn wǒ zǎoyǐ dúguò, érqiě wǒ juédé tā fēicháng yǐnrénrùshèng.
examples.en: I had read this work of his long ago, and I found it very engaging.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_早已_zǎoyǐ_-_Long_ago_for_a_long_time_20231230_他这部作品我早已读过而且我觉得它非常引人入胜.mp3

examples.cn: 事实上，我早已接受了这个事实，虽然它很艰难。
examples.pinyin: Shìshí shàng, wǒ zǎoyǐ jiēshòule zhège shìshí, suīrán tā hěn jiānnán.
examples.en: In fact, I accepted this truth a long time ago, even though it was difficult.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_早已_zǎoyǐ_-_Long_ago_for_a_long_time_20231230_事实上我早已接受了这个事实虽然它很艰难.mp3

examples.cn: 你早已拥有了你所需要的一切，你只需要找到它在哪里。
examples.pinyin: Nǐ zǎoyǐ yōngyǒu le nǐ suǒ xūyào de yīqiè, nǐ zhǐ xūyào zhǎodào tā zài nǎlǐ.
examples.en: You've had all that you needed a long time ago, you only need to find out where it is.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_早已_zǎoyǐ_-_Long_ago_for_a_long_time_20231230_你早已拥有了你所需要的一切你只需要找到它在哪里.mp3

title: 何况 (hékuàng) - Let alone, not to mention
short_explanation: Used to introduce an even stronger situation or point after having made a previous one.
long_explanation: The Mandarin Chinese phrase '何况 (hékuàng)' is similar to 'let alone' or 'not to mention' in English. It's used to describe an even more incisive circumstance or argument after an original point has been established, often to highlight a contrast or emphasize one's point.

examples.cn: 我连普通的中文都说不流利，何况专业的词汇了。
examples.pinyin: Wǒ lián pǔtōng de zhōngwén dōu shuō bùliúlì, hékuàng zhuānyè de cíhuì le.
examples.en: I can't even speak ordinary Chinese fluently, let alone professional vocabulary.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_何况_hékuàng_-_Let_alone_not_to_mention_20231230_我连普通的中文都说不流利何况专业的词汇了.mp3

examples.cn: 他连他自己的房间都不会打扫，何况整个房子。
examples.pinyin: Tā lián tā zìjǐ de fángjiān dōu bù huì dǎsǎo, hékuàng zhěnggè fángzi.
examples.en: He can't even clean his own room, not to mention the whole house.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_何况_hékuàng_-_Let_alone_not_to_mention_20231230_他连他自己的房间都不会打扫何况整个房子.mp3

examples.cn: 我如果连普通的问题都不能解决，何况这样的困难题目。
examples.pinyin: Wǒ rúguǒ lián pǔtōng de wèntí dōu bùnéng jiějué, hékuàng zhèyàng de kùnnántímù.
examples.en: If I can't even solve ordinary problems, let alone such difficult questions.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_何况_hékuàng_-_Let_alone_not_to_mention_20231230_我如果连普通的问题都不能解决何况这样的困难题目.mp3

examples.cn: 他连小学的数学题都不能做，何况高中的物理题。
examples.pinyin: Tā lián xiǎoxué de shùxué tí dōu bùnéng zuò, hékuàng gāozhōng de wùlǐ tí.
examples.en: He can't even do primary school math problems, let alone high school physics problems.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_何况_hékuàng_-_Let_alone_not_to_mention_20231230_他连小学的数学题都不能做何况高中的物理题.mp3

title: 哪怕 (nǎpà) - Even if, Even though
short_explanation: This is used to show a condition upon which an action is reliant.
long_explanation: '哪怕 (nǎpà)' is a conjunction in Mandarin Chinese used to express a hypothetical condition upon which an action is based. It translates to 'even if' or 'even though' in English. When using '哪怕', we indicate an extreme situation rather than an average or expected one.

examples.cn: 哪怕下雨，我也会去公园。
examples.pinyin: Nǎpà xiàyǔ, wǒ yě huì qù gōngyuán.
examples.en: Even if it rains, I will go to the park.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_哪怕_nǎpà_-_Even_if_Even_though_20231230_哪怕下雨我也会去公园.mp3

examples.cn: 哪怕今天很忙，我也会完成我的作业。
examples.pinyin: Nǎpà jīntiān hěn máng, wǒ yě huì wánchéng wǒ de zuòyè.
examples.en: Even though I am busy today, I will complete my homework.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_哪怕_nǎpà_-_Even_if_Even_though_20231230_哪怕今天很忙我也会完成我的作业.mp3

examples.cn: 哪怕明天考试，他还是玩电脑游戏。
examples.pinyin: Nǎpà míngtiān kǎoshì, tā háishì wán diànnǎo yóuxì.
examples.en: Even though he has an exam tomorrow, he still plays computer games.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_哪怕_nǎpà_-_Even_if_Even_though_20231230_哪怕明天考试他还是玩电脑游戏.mp3

examples.cn: 哪怕风雪交加，他们依然坚持训练。
examples.pinyin: Nǎpà fēng xuě jiāojiā, tāmen yīrán jiānchí xùnliàn.
examples.en: Even though the weather is snowing violently, they still insist on training.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_哪怕_nǎpà_-_Even_if_Even_though_20231230_哪怕风雪交加他们依然坚持训练.mp3

title: 更不用说 (gèng bùyòng shuō) - Not to mention, let alone
short_explanation: Used to emphasize that if one thing is true, then something else mentioned is definitely also true.
long_explanation: The phrase '更不用说 (gèng bùyòng shuō)' is typically used in Mandarin Chinese to emphasize a point by stating that if one thing is certainly true, then the second, usually more significant or impressive, thing is undoubtedly also true. It is similar to the English phrases 'not to mention' or 'let alone'. The phrase is often used in situations when something is so obvious or certain that it does not need to be mentioned.
formation: Statement/Point A + 更不用说 + Statement/Point B

examples.cn: 我都没时间看电视，更不用说去电影院看电影了。
examples.pinyin: Wǒ dōu méi shíjiān kàn diànshì, gèng bùyòng shuō qù diànyǐngyuàn kàn diànyǐng le.
examples.en: I don't even have time to watch TV, let alone go to the cinema to watch a movie.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_更不用说_gèng_bùyòng_shuō_-_Not_to_mention_let_alone_20231230_我都没时间看电视更不用说去电影院看电影了.mp3

examples.cn: 她连中文都说不好，更不用说写中文了。
examples.pinyin: Tā lián Zhōngwén dōu shuō bù hǎo, gèng bùyòng shuō xiě Zhōngwén le.
examples.en: She can't even speak Chinese well, let alone write in Chinese.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_更不用说_gèng_bùyòng_shuō_-_Not_to_mention_let_alone_20231230_她连中文都说不好更不用说写中文了.mp3

examples.cn: 他们的队伍甚至没有进入决赛，更不用说获得冠军了。
examples.pinyin: Tāmen de duìwǔ shènzhì méiyǒu jìnrù juésài, gèng bùyòng shuō huòdé guànjūn le.
examples.en: Their team didn't even make it to the finals, not to mention winning the championship.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_更不用说_gèng_bùyòng_shuō_-_Not_to_mention_let_alone_20231230_他们的队伍甚至没有进入决赛更不用说获得冠军了.mp3

examples.cn: 他做事不认真，更不用说负责了。
examples.pinyin: Tā zuò shì bù rènzhēn, gèng bùyòng shuō fùzé le.
examples.en: He is not serious when doing things, let alone be responsible.

title: 为难 (wéinán) - To make things difficult for, to feel embarrassed
short_explanation: It is used to express the feeling of being in a difficult situation or being embarrassed.
long_explanation: The Mandarin Chinese phrase '为难 (wéinán)' translates more literally into 'for difficulty'. It is often used to express feelings of embarrassment or predicaments. It can also be used to indicate that someone is in a situation of making things difficult for others.
formation: Subject + 为难 + Rest of the sentence.

examples.cn: 我真不想给你带来麻烦，让你为难。
examples.pinyin: Wǒ zhēn bùxiǎng gěi nǐ dài lái máfan, ràng nǐ wéinán.
examples.en: I really don’t want to trouble you and put you in a difficult position.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_为难_wéinán_-_To_make_things_difficult_for_to_feel_embarrassed_20231230_我真不想给你带来麻烦让你为难.mp3

examples.cn: 他把我放在一个为难的境地：我可能会丢掉工作，也可能会失去朋友。
examples.pinyin: Tā bǎ wǒ fàng zài yīgè wéinán de jìngdì: wǒ kěnéng huì diū diào gōngzuò, yě kěnéng huì shīqù péngyǒu.
examples.en: He put me in a difficult position: I could either lose my job or lose my friend.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_为难_wéinán_-_To_make_things_difficult_for_to_feel_embarrassed_20231230_他把我放在一个为难的境地：我可能会丢掉工作也可能会失去朋友.mp3

examples.cn: 我不想在你和她之间为难。
examples.pinyin: Wǒ bùxiǎng zài nǐ hé tā zhījiān wéinán.
examples.en: I don't want to be caught in an awkward position between you and her.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_为难_wéinán_-_To_make_things_difficult_for_to_feel_embarrassed_20231230_我不想在你和她之间为难.mp3

examples.cn: 我知道这会让你为难，但我需要你的帮助。
examples.pinyin: Wǒ zhīdào zhè huì ràng nǐ wéinán, dàn wǒ xūyào nǐ de bāngzhù.
examples.en: I know this will put you in a difficult position, but I need your help.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_为难_wéinán_-_To_make_things_difficult_for_to_feel_embarrassed_20231230_我知道这会让你为难但我需要你的帮助.mp3

title: 相反 (xiāngfǎn) - On the contrary, instead
short_explanation: Used to indicate a contrasting idea or fact.
long_explanation: The Mandarin Chinese expression '相反 (xiāngfǎn)' is used to introduce a contrasting idea or fact that is opposed to what has been previously mentioned. It can be seen as equivalent to using 'on the contrary' or 'instead' in English. This phrase is often used to highlight the difference between two viewpoints, actions, or outcomes.
formation: Subject + Verb/Adjective +，相反，+ Contrasting Verb/Adjective + Rest of the sentence

examples.cn: 我不是讨厌你，相反，我很喜欢你。
examples.pinyin: Wǒ bùshì tǎoyàn nǐ, xiāngfǎn, wǒ hěn xǐhuān nǐ.
examples.en: I don't hate you, on the contrary, I like you very much.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_相反_xiāngfǎn_-_On_the_contrary_instead_20231230_我不是讨厌你相反我很喜欢你.mp3

examples.cn: 他不懒散，相反，他是我知道的最勤快的人。
examples.pinyin: Tā bù lǎnsàn, xiāngfǎn, tā shì wǒ zhīdào de zuì qínkuài de rén.
examples.en: He is not lazy, on the contrary, he is the most industrious person I know.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_相反_xiāngfǎn_-_On_the_contrary_instead_20231230_他不懒散相反他是我知道的最勤快的人.mp3

examples.cn: 他们并没有失败，相反，他们取得了巨大的成功。
examples.pinyin: Tāmen bìng méiyǒu shībài, xiāngfǎn, tāmen qǔdéle jùdà de chénggōng.
examples.en: They did not fail, on the contrary, they achieved great success.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_相反_xiāngfǎn_-_On_the_contrary_instead_20231230_他们并没有失败相反他们取得了巨大的成功.mp3

examples.cn: 我不觉得这部电影无聊，相反，我觉得非常有趣。
examples.pinyin: Wǒ bù juédé zhè bù diànyǐng wúliáo, xiāngfǎn, wǒ juédé fēicháng yǒuqù.
examples.en: I don't think this movie is boring, on the contrary, I find it very interesting.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_相反_xiāngfǎn_-_On_the_contrary_instead_20231230_我不觉得这部电影无聊相反我觉得非常有趣.mp3

title: 此外 (cǐwài) - Besides, in addition
short_explanation: Used to introduce supplementary information or enumerate extra items.
long_explanation: The Mandarin Chinese phrase '此外 (cǐwài)' is used to include additional information in your conversation or writing. It corresponds to 'besides' or 'in addition' in English. It is a handy term when you want to provide extra details or enumerate more items without starting a new sentence.

examples.cn: 他很善良，此外他非常聪明。
examples.pinyin: Tā hěn shànliáng, cǐwài tā fēicháng cōngmíng.
examples.en: He is very kind, besides he is very smart.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_此外_cǐwài_-_Besides_in_addition_20231230_他很善良此外他非常聪明.mp3

examples.cn: 我喜欢读小说，此外，我也喜欢看电影。
examples.pinyin: Wǒ xǐhuān dú xiǎoshuō, cǐwài, wǒ yě xǐhuān kàn diànyǐng.
examples.en: I like reading novels, in addition, I also like watching movies.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_此外_cǐwài_-_Besides_in_addition_20231230_我喜欢读小说此外我也喜欢看电影.mp3

examples.cn: 他的主要工作是教书，此外，他还在写一本书。
examples.pinyin: Tā de zhǔyào gōngzuò shì jiāoshū, cǐwài, tā hái zài xiě yī běn shū.
examples.en: His main job is teaching, in addition, he is also writing a book.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_此外_cǐwài_-_Besides_in_addition_20231230_他的主要工作是教书此外他还在写一本书.mp3

examples.cn: 她热心工作，此外，她对人总是非常有礼貌。
examples.pinyin: Tā rèxīn gōngzuò, cǐwài, tā duì rén zǒng shì fēicháng yǒulǐmào.
examples.en: She works enthusiastically, besides, she is always very polite to people.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_此外_cǐwài_-_Besides_in_addition_20231230_她热心工作此外她对人总是非常有礼貌.mp3

title: 要么...要么... (yàome... yàome...) - Either... or...
short_explanation: Used to express two or more possible alternatives or choices.
long_explanation: The Mandarin Chinese structure '要么...要么...' is used to present two or more possible options or alternatives in a situation. It's similar to the English structure 'either... or...'. This phrase is often used when the speaker wants to indicate that only one of the given options can be chosen or will happen.
formation: 要么 + Option 1, 要么 + Option 2

examples.cn: 你要么今天来我家，要么明天来。
examples.pinyin: Nǐ yàome jīntiān lái wǒ jiā, yàome míngtiān lái.
examples.en: You can either come to my house today, or tomorrow.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_要么要么_yàome_yàome_-_Either_or_20231230_你要么今天来我家要么明天来.mp3

examples.cn: 我要么去健身房运动，要么在家休息。
examples.pinyin: Wǒ yàome qù jiànshēnfáng yùndòng, yàome zài jiā xiūxī.
examples.en: I will either go to the gym for a workout, or I will rest at home.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_要么要么_yàome_yàome_-_Either_or_20231230_我要么去健身房运动要么在家休息.mp3

examples.cn: 你要么专心学习，要么就离开这个教室。
examples.pinyin: Nǐ yàome zhuānxīn xuéxí, yàome jiù líkāi zhège jiàoshì.
examples.en: You either study with concentration, or you leave this classroom.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_要么要么_yàome_yàome_-_Either_or_20231230_你要么专心学习要么就离开这个教室.mp3

examples.cn: 要么上午去公园散步，要么下午去看电影。
examples.pinyin: Yàome shàngwǔ qù gōngyuán sànbù, yàome xiàwǔ qù kàn diànyǐng.
examples.en: Either go to the park for a walk in the morning, or go to see a movie in the afternoon.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_要么要么_yàome_yàome_-_Either_or_20231230_要么上午去公园散步要么下午去看电影.mp3

title: 与其...不如... (yǔqí... bùrú...) - Rather than... it's better to...
short_explanation: Used to express a comparative preference for one thing over another.
long_explanation: The Mandarin Chinese phrase '与其...不如...' (yǔqí... bùrú...) is used to express a preference for one action or situation over another. It is equivalent to saying 'Rather than... it's better to...' in English. It's usually used to compare two choices or alternatives, expressing that the one after '不如' is better.
formation: 与其 + Action/Situation 1 + 不如 + Action/Situation 2

examples.cn: 与其在家里无聊，不如出去走走。
examples.pinyin: Yǔqí zài jiā lǐ wúliáo, bùrú chūqù zǒu zǒu.
examples.en: Rather than being bored at home, it's better to go out for a walk.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_与其不如_yǔqí_bùrú_-_Rather_than_its_better_to_20231230_与其在家里无聊不如出去走走.mp3

examples.cn: 与其为了小事和他争吵，不如谅解他。
examples.pinyin: Yǔqí wèile xiǎo shì hé tā zhēngchǎo, bùrú liàngjiě tā.
examples.en: Rather than arguing with him over small things, it's better to forgive him.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_与其不如_yǔqí_bùrú_-_Rather_than_its_better_to_20231230_与其为了小事和他争吵不如谅解他.mp3

examples.cn: 与其整天担心失败，不如把精力放在努力工作上。
examples.pinyin: Yǔqí zhěngtiān dānxīn shībài, bùrú bǎ jīnglì fàng zài nǔlì gōngzuò shàng.
examples.en: Rather than worrying about failure all day, it's better to focus your energy on working hard.

examples.cn: 与其浪费时间抱怨，不如行动起来改变情况。

title: 根据 (gēnjù) - According to, based on
short_explanation: Used to express the source of information or basis of an action or decision.
long_explanation: The Mandarin Chinese phrase '根据 (gēnjù)' is a preposition that generally means 'according to' or 'based on'. This phrase is used to express the source or foundation from which one has obtained information, made an action or formed an opinion. It's often followed by evidence, rules, or facts.
formation: 根据 + Source / Evidence / Fact + Comment / Action

examples.cn: 根据天气预报，明天会下雨。
examples.pinyin: Gēnjù tiānqì yùbào, míngtiān huì xià yǔ.
examples.en: According to the weather forecast, it will rain tomorrow.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_根据_gēnjù_-_According_to_based_on_20231230_根据天气预报明天会下雨.mp3

examples.cn: 根据我的理解，这个词的意思是'快乐'。
examples.pinyin: Gēnjù wǒ de lǐjiě, zhège cí de yìsi shì 'kuàilè'.
examples.en: Based on my understanding, the meaning of this word is 'happiness'.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_根据_gēnjù_-_According_to_based_on_20231230_根据我的理解这个词的意思是快乐.mp3

examples.cn: 我们根据公司的政策更新了我们的计划。
examples.pinyin: Wǒmen gēnjù gōngsī de zhèngcè gēngxīnle wǒmen de jìhuà.
examples.en: We updated our plans based on the company's policy.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_根据_gēnjù_-_According_to_based_on_20231230_我们根据公司的政策更新了我们的计划.mp3

examples.cn: 他根据她的脸色判断她不舒服。
examples.pinyin: Tā gēnjù tā de liǎnsè pànduàn tā bù shūfú.
examples.en: He judged that she was not feeling well based on her complexion.

title: 尽力 (jǐnlì) - To do one's best
short_explanation: This is used to express trying or striving to do something to the best of one's ability.
long_explanation: The Mandarin Chinese term '尽力 (jǐnlì)' is used when you want to express that you or someone else is doing their utmost or trying their best to achieve or accomplish something. It indicates a high level of effort and dedication towards a particular task or goal. This can be applied to various contexts such as doing homework, studying for an exam, running a marathon, etc.

examples.cn: 我会尽力帮你解决这个问题的。
examples.pinyin: Wǒ huì jǐnlì bāng nǐ jiějué zhège wèntí de.
examples.en: I will do my best to help you solve this problem.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_尽力_jǐnlì_-_To_do_ones_best_20231230_我会尽力帮你解决这个问题的.mp3

examples.cn: 他们尽力完成了所有的任务。
examples.pinyin: Tāmen jǐnlì wánchéngle suǒyǒu de rènwù.
examples.en: They did their best to complete all the tasks.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_尽力_jǐnlì_-_To_do_ones_best_20231230_他们尽力完成了所有的任务.mp3

examples.cn: 为了赢得比赛，我们队尽力了。
examples.pinyin: Wèile yíngdé bǐsài, wǒmende duì jǐnlì le.
examples.en: Our team did its best to win the match.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_尽力_jǐnlì_-_To_do_ones_best_20231230_为了赢得比赛我们队尽力了.mp3

examples.cn: 你应该尽力学习这个新的语言。

examples.en: You should do your best to learn this new language.

title: 除...之外 (chú... zhīwài) - Apart from, besides
short_explanation: Used to emphasize that in addition to the person or thing mentioned, there are other people or things involved.
long_explanation: '除...之外 (chú... zhīwài)' is a Mandarin Chinese grammatical structure used to indicate exception or standing out from a group. It literally translates to 'apart from' or 'besides' in English. It implies that something is not only this but also that, or someone is not only this person but also that person. It can be used with both nouns and verb phrases, and is often used in the context of making exceptions or highlighting a specific instance from a general group.
formation: (Noun/Verb Phrase) + 除...之外 + Rest of the sentence?

examples.cn: 除了工作之外，他还经营一家小公司。
examples.pinyin: Chúle gōngzuò zhīwài, tā hái jīngyíng yī jiā xiǎo gōngsī.
examples.en: Besides working, he also runs a small company.

examples.cn: 除了你之外，我不会喜欢别的男人。
examples.pinyin: Chúle nǐ zhīwài, wǒ bù huì xǐhuān bié de nánrén.
examples.en: Apart from you, I wouldn't like other men.

examples.cn: 除了英语之外，他还会说法语和德语。

examples.en: He speaks French and German, in addition to English.

examples.cn: 除了吃和睡觉之外，猫不会做什么。
examples.pinyin: Chúle chī hé shuìjiào zhīwài, māo bú huì zuò shénme.
examples.en: Apart from eating and sleeping, cats don't do much.

title: 始终 (shǐzhōng) - From beginning to end, all along
short_explanation: Used to express an action or state that continuous from the first to the last without intermittence.
long_explanation: The Mandarin Chinese phrase '始终 (shǐzhōng)' is employed to describe an action or a state which continues from the first to the last without interruption. This can be something that happens 'all along', 'from beginning to end', or 'from start to finish'.
formation: 子句1 + 始终 + 子句2

examples.cn: 他虽然感到困惑，但是始终没有放弃学习中文。
examples.pinyin: Tā suīrán gǎndào kùnhuò, dànshì shǐzhōng méiyǒu fàngqì xuéxí Zhōngwén.
examples.en: Although he felt confused, he never gave up studying Chinese from beginning to end.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_始终_shǐzhōng_-_From_beginning_to_end_all_along_20231230_他虽然感到困惑但是始终没有放弃学习中文.mp3

examples.cn: 我始终相信你会成功的，你必须对自己有信心。

examples.en: I have always believed that you will succeed, you must have confidence in yourself.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_始终_shǐzhōng_-_From_beginning_to_end_all_along_20231230_我始终相信你会成功的你必须对自己有信心.mp3

examples.cn: 为了实现我的梦想，我始终都在努力。
examples.pinyin: Wèi le shíxiàn wǒ de mèngxiǎng, wǒ shǐzhōng dōu zài nǔlì.
examples.en: In order to achieve my dream, I have been working hard from beginning to end.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_始终_shǐzhōng_-_From_beginning_to_end_all_along_20231230_为了实现我的梦想我始终都在努力.mp3

examples.cn: 她对自己的工作始终充满了热情。
examples.pinyin: Tā duì zìjǐ de gōngzuò shǐzhōng chōngmǎnle rèqíng.
examples.en: She is always full of passion for her work.

title: 正如 (zhèngrú) - Just as, As
short_explanation: Used to express that something is exactly as stated or mentioned previously.
long_explanation: The Mandarin Chinese phrase '正如 (zhèngrú)' is an expression used to illustrate a point of comparison or similarity between two things, events, or situations. It represents the English equivalent of 'just as' or 'as'. This phrase is often used to emphasize a comparative statement or to provide an example clarifying an earlier statement.

examples.cn: 正如你所说，学习中文需要耐心和毅力。
examples.pinyin: Zhèngrú nǐ suǒ shuō, xuéxí Zhōngwén xūyào nàixīn hé yìlì.
examples.en: As you said, learning Chinese requires patience and perseverance.

examples.cn: 正如他们所预期的那样，公司的销售额去年增长了20％。
examples.pinyin: Zhèngrú tāmen suǒ yùqí de nà yàng, gōngsī de xiāoshòu'é qùnián zēngzhǎng le 20％.
examples.en: Just as they expected, the company's sales increased by 20% last year.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_正如_zhèngrú_-_Just_as_As_20231230_正如他们所预期的那样公司的销售额去年增长了20％.mp3

examples.cn: 正如我之前提到的，我们必须要提高产品的质量。
examples.pinyin: Zhèngrú wǒ zhīqián tí dào de, wǒmen bìxū yào tígāo chǎnpǐn de zhìliàng.
examples.en: As I mentioned earlier, we need to improve the quality of our products.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_正如_zhèngrú_-_Just_as_As_20231230_正如我之前提到的我们必须要提高产品的质量.mp3

examples.cn: 正如大部分人所知，抽烟对健康有害。
examples.pinyin: Zhèngrú dà bùfèn rén suǒ zhī, chōuyān duì jiànkāng yǒuhài.
examples.en: As is known by most people, smoking is harmful to health.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_正如_zhèngrú_-_Just_as_As_20231230_正如大部分人所知抽烟对健康有害.mp3

title: 正巧 (zhèngqiǎo) - Coincidentally, just in time
short_explanation: Used to express a coincidence or a situation happening perfectly on time.
long_explanation: The Mandarin Chinese word '正巧 (zhèngqiǎo)' is used when you want to convey the sense of a situation occurring coincidentally or something happening just at the right timing. It's equivalent to saying 'coincidentally' or 'just in time' in English. Usually, it's used for unexpected but well-timed events.
formation: Subject + 正巧 + Verb/Action + Rest of the Sentence

examples.cn: 我正在找他, 他正巧也在找我。
examples.pinyin: Wǒ zhèngzài zhǎo tā, tā zhèng qiǎo yě zài zhǎo wǒ.
examples.en: I was looking for him, and coincidentally, he was also looking for me.

examples.cn: 我正巧到家, 电话就响了。
examples.pinyin: Wǒ zhèng qiǎo dào jiā, diànhuà jiù xiǎng le.
examples.en: I just got home when the phone rang.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_正巧_zhèngqiǎo_-_Coincidentally_just_in_time_20231230_我正巧到家_电话就响了.mp3

examples.cn: 你来得正巧, 我们正在讨论你的计划。
examples.pinyin: Nǐ lái de zhèng qiǎo, wǒmen zhèngzài tǎolùn nǐ de jìhuà.
examples.en: You came just in time, we were discussing your plan.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_正巧_zhèngqiǎo_-_Coincidentally_just_in_time_20231230_你来得正巧_我们正在讨论你的计划.mp3

examples.cn: 我正打算去书店,正巧我妹妹也要去。
examples.pinyin: Wǒ zhèng dǎsuàn qù shūdiàn, zhèng qiǎo wǒ mèimei yě yào qù.
examples.en: I was just planning to go to the bookstore, coincidentally my sister also wanted to go.

title: 若是 (ruòshì) - If, in case
short_explanation: Used to express conditions or hypothetical scenarios.
long_explanation: The Mandarin Chinese phrase '若是 (ruòshì)' is a useful term equivalent to 'if' or 'in case' in English. This phrase is typically used to introduce a condition or hypothetical scenario, followed by the consequence or result that would occur if the condition was met or the scenario took place.

examples.cn: 若是你有时间，我们可以一起去看电影。
examples.pinyin: Ruòshì nǐ yǒu shíjiān, wǒmen kěyǐ yīqǐ qù kàn diànyǐng.
examples.en: If you have time, we can go to watch a movie together.

examples.cn: 若是明天下雨，比赛可能会被取消。
examples.pinyin: Ruòshì míngtiān xiàyǔ, bǐsài kěnéng huì bèi qǔxiāo.
examples.en: If it rains tomorrow, the match might be cancelled.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_若是_ruòshì_-_If_in_case_20231230_若是明天下雨比赛可能会被取消.mp3

examples.cn: 若是你不回来，我就自己去。
examples.pinyin: Ruòshì nǐ bù huílái, wǒ jiù zìjǐ qù.
examples.en: If you don't come back, I'll go by myself.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_若是_ruòshì_-_If_in_case_20231230_若是你不回来我就自己去.mp3

examples.cn: 若是他问你，你告诉他真相。
examples.pinyin: Ruòshì tā wèn nǐ, nǐ gàosu tā zhēnxiàng.
examples.en: If he asks you, tell him the truth.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_若是_ruòshì_-_If_in_case_20231230_若是他问你你告诉他真相.mp3

title: 与其说...不如说... (yǔqí shuō... bùrú shuō...) - Rather than saying... it's better to say...
short_explanation: This pattern expresses that 'it is better to say... than to say...', implying that the second statement is more fitting or accurate than the first one.
long_explanation: 在中文中，'与其说...不如说...'这个句型用于表述两种事实或者观点，它表明第二个陈述比第一个更加恰当或者准确。这是一种修辞手法，用来强调一个比较微妙或具有争议性的点。
formation: 与其说 + Statement A + 不如说 + Statement B

examples.cn: 与其说他是绘画爱好者，不如说他是一个专业的画家。
examples.pinyin: yǔqí shuō tā shì huìhuà àihào zhě, bùrú shuō tā shì yīgè zhuānyè de huàjiā.
examples.en: Rather than saying he is a painting enthusiast, it's better to say he is a professional painter.

examples.cn: 与其说我是在读书，不如说我是在通过书本了解世界。

examples.en: Rather than saying I am reading, it's better to say I am understanding the world through books.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_与其说不如说_yǔqí_shuō_bùrú_shuō_-_Rather_than_saying_its_better_to_say_20231230_与其说我是在读书不如说我是在通过书本了解世界.mp3

examples.cn: 与其说这是一个问题的解决方案，不如说这是一个避免问题的策略。

examples.en: Rather than saying this is a solution to a problem, it's better to say it is a strategy to avoid the problem.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_与其说不如说_yǔqí_shuō_bùrú_shuō_-_Rather_than_saying_its_better_to_say_20231230_与其说这是一个问题的解决方案不如说这是一个避免问题的策略.mp3

examples.cn: 与其说他对音乐感兴趣，不如说音乐是他的生命。

title: 凭 (píng) - Rely on, according to
short_explanation: Used to express the basis or standard of something or the means by which something is done.
long_explanation: The Mandarin Chinese term '凭 (píng)' is often employed to denote the basis or standard of a certain process or conclusion. It is equivalent to 'rely on', 'according to' or 'based on' in English and is used to express the means by which something is accomplished or performed or the criterion used for judgment or decision making.

examples.cn: 我凭良心说，我并没有做错任何事情。
examples.pinyin: Wǒ píng liángxīn shuō, wǒ bìng méiyǒu zuò cuò rènhé shìqíng.
examples.en: I declare in good conscience that I have done nothing wrong.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_凭_píng_-_Rely_on_according_to_20231230_我凭良心说我并没有做错任何事情.mp3

examples.cn: 你不能光凭外表去评价一个人。
examples.pinyin: Nǐ bùnéng guāng píng wàibiǎo qù píngjià yīgè rén.

examples.cn: 他凭票可以不花钱进电影院看电影。

examples.cn: 我凭记忆绘制出了这幅地图。

title: 连...都/也... (lián... dōu/yě...) - Even...
short_explanation: This structure is used to express unexpected situations or emphasize the degree of something.
long_explanation: The phrase 连...都/也... is a common sentence pattern in Mandarin Chinese. It's used when the speaker wants to emphasize an unexpected situation, or that something is true to such a degree that it even applies to the person or thing being talked about. The sentence structure '连...都/也...' is often translated in English as 'even...' and is generally used to highlight the scope or extent of a particular situation.

examples.cn: 这个问题连我都不会回答，更不用说你了。
examples.pinyin: Zhè ge wèntí lián wǒ dōu bù huì huídá, gèng bùyòng shuō nǐ le.
examples.en: Even I can't answer this question, let alone you.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_连都/也_lián_dōu/yě_-_Even_20231230_这个问题连我都不会回答更不用说你了.mp3

examples.cn: 他连早餐也不吃就去上班了。
examples.pinyin: Tā lián zǎocān yě bú chī jiù qù shàngbān le.
examples.en: He went to work without even eating breakfast.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_连都/也_lián_dōu/yě_-_Even_20231230_他连早餐也不吃就去上班了.mp3

examples.cn: 连老师都没看懂那个数学题。

title: 何必 (hébì) - Why should, why must
short_explanation: Used to question the necessity or need to do something.
long_explanation: The Mandarin Chinese phrase '何必 (hébì)' is often used to express doubt or question the necessity of a certain action or situation. It translates to 'why should' or 'why must' in English, and is typically used in rhetorical questions, suggesting that something is unnecessary or avoidable.

examples.cn: 何必为了那么小的事情而生气？
examples.pinyin: Hébì wèile nàme xiǎo de shìqíng ér shēngqì?
examples.en: Why should you get angry over such a small thing?
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_何必_hébì_-_Why_should_why_must_20231230_何必为了那么小的事情而生气.mp3

examples.cn: 何必跑那么远的地方去买东西？我们这里的商店也有。
examples.pinyin: Hébì pǎo nàme yuǎn de dìfang qù mǎi dōngxi? Wǒmen zhèlǐ de shāngdiàn yě yǒu.
examples.en: Why should you go so far to buy things? We also have them in our local store.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_何必_hébì_-_Why_should_why_must_20231230_何必跑那么远的地方去买东西我们这里的商店也有.mp3

examples.cn: 你何必去参加那个没意义的会议？
examples.pinyin: Nǐ hébì qù cānjiā nàgè méiyìyì de huìyì?
examples.en: Why should you attend that meaningless meeting?
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_何必_hébì_-_Why_should_why_must_20231230_你何必去参加那个没意义的会议.mp3

examples.cn: 他何必每天工作到很晚，又疲劳又压力大？
examples.pinyin: Tā hébì měitiān gōngzuò dào hěn wǎn, yòu píláo yòu yālì dà?
examples.en: Why should he work until late every day, feeling both tired and stressed?
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_何必_hébì_-_Why_should_why_must_20231230_他何必每天工作到很晚又疲劳又压力大.mp3

title: 除非...否则... (chúfēi... fǒuzé...) - Unless... otherwise...
short_explanation: Used to express 'unless' or 'only if' in a condition, followed by an inevitable result or a consequence.
long_explanation: The Mandarin Chinese grammar point '除非...否则...' is nearly equivalent to 'unless... otherwise...' in English. '除非' presents a condition or situation, while '否则' presents the consequences if the condition mentioned isn't met or fulfilled. It is used to express the idea that only if the condition presented by '除非' happens, the resultant effects presented by '否则' won't happen.
formation: 除非 + Condition/A, 否则 + Consequence/B

examples.cn: 除非你把作业写完，否则不能看电视。
examples.pinyin: Chúfēi nǐ bǎ zuòyè xiě wán, fǒuzé bù néng kàn diànshì.
examples.en: Unless you finish your homework, you can't watch TV.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_除非否则_chúfēi_fǒuzé_-_Unless_otherwise_20231230_除非你把作业写完否则不能看电视.mp3

examples.cn: 除非你告诉我真相，否则我不会原谅你。
examples.pinyin: Chúfēi nǐ gàosù wǒ zhēnxiàng, fǒuzé wǒ bù huì yuánliàng nǐ.
examples.en: Unless you tell me the truth, I will not forgive you.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_除非否则_chúfēi_fǒuzé_-_Unless_otherwise_20231230_除非你告诉我真相否则我不会原谅你.mp3

examples.cn: 除非你穿上雨衣，否则你会淋湿。
examples.pinyin: Chúfēi nǐ chuān shàng yǔ yī, fǒuzé nǐ huì lín shī.
examples.en: Unless you put on your raincoat, you will get wet.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_除非否则_chúfēi_fǒuzé_-_Unless_otherwise_20231230_除非你穿上雨衣否则你会淋湿.mp3

examples.cn: 除非你好好学习，否则你不可能通过这次考试。
examples.pinyin: Chúfēi nǐ hǎohào xuéxí, fǒuzé nǐ bù kěnéng tōngguò zhè cì kǎoshì.
examples.en: Unless you study well, you can't possibly pass this exam.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_除非否则_chúfēi_fǒuzé_-_Unless_otherwise_20231230_除非你好好学习否则你不可能通过这次考试.mp3

title: 只要...就... (zhǐyào... jiù...) - As long as... then...
short_explanation: Used to express the condition and result.
long_explanation: The Mandarin Chinese construction '只要...就...' is used to denote conditions and results. It means 'as long as' or 'provided that,' often introducing a necessary condition (following 只要) and a resulting action or situation (following 就). The condition is stated after '只要,' and the result or consequence is stated after '就.'

examples.cn: 只要你努力学习，就能通过汉语水平考试。
examples.pinyin: Zhǐyào nǐ nǔlì xuéxí, jiù néng tōngguò Hànyǔ shuǐpíng kǎoshì.
examples.en: As long as you study hard, you can pass the Chinese Proficiency Test.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_只要就_zhǐyào_jiù_-_As_long_as_then_20231230_只要你努力学习就能通过汉语水平考试.mp3

examples.cn: 只要你保持健康的生活方式，就可以维持良好的身体健康。
examples.pinyin: Zhǐyào nǐ bǎochí jiànkāng de shēnghuó fāngshì, jiù kěyǐ wéichí liánghǎo de shēntǐ jiànkāng.
examples.en: As long as you maintain a healthy lifestyle, you can maintain good physical health.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_只要就_zhǐyào_jiù_-_As_long_as_then_20231230_只要你保持健康的生活方式就可以维持良好的身体健康.mp3

examples.cn: 只要我们坚持下去，就会看到成功的那一天。
examples.pinyin: Zhǐyào wǒmen jiānchí xiàqù, jiù huì kàn dào chénggōng de nà yītiān.
examples.en: As long as we keep going, we will see the day of success.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_只要就_zhǐyào_jiù_-_As_long_as_then_20231230_只要我们坚持下去就会看到成功的那一天.mp3

examples.cn: 只要天气好，我们就去公园散步。
examples.pinyin: Zhǐyào tiānqì hǎo, wǒmen jiù qù gōngyuán sànbù.
examples.en: As long as the weather is good, we will go for a walk in the park.

title: 尽管...但是... (jǐnguǎn... dànshì...) - Although... but...
short_explanation: Used to express the contrast between two situations.
long_explanation: The Mandarin Chinese phrase '尽管...但是... (jǐnguǎn... dànshì...)' is used to express two contrasting situations or facts. The first part of sentence after '尽管' expresses a condition, and the part after '但是' presents a contrast or exception to the first part. It is equivalent to 'although... but...' in English.
formation: 尽管 + Statement 1, 但是 + Statement 2

examples.cn: 尽管他非常忙碌，但是他还是决定帮助我完成这个项目。
examples.pinyin: Jǐnguǎn tā fēicháng mánglù, dànshì tā háishì juédìng bāngzhù wǒ wánchéng zhège xiàngmù.
examples.en: Although he is very busy, he still decided to help me complete this project.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_尽管但是_jǐnguǎn_dànshì_-_Although_but_20231230_尽管他非常忙碌但是他还是决定帮助我完成这个项目.mp3

examples.cn: 尽管外面正在下雨，但是我们还是去公园散步了。
examples.pinyin: Jǐnguǎn wàimiàn zhèngzài xià yǔ, dànshì wǒmen háishì qù gōngyuán sànbù le.
examples.en: Although it is raining outside, we still went for a walk in the park.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_尽管但是_jǐnguǎn_dànshì_-_Although_but_20231230_尽管外面正在下雨但是我们还是去公园散步了.mp3

examples.cn: 尽管你穿得很保暖，但是在这样的寒冷天气里，你还是会感到冷。
examples.pinyin: Jǐnguǎn nǐ chuān dé hěn bǎonuǎn, dànshì zài zhèyàng de hánlěng tiānqì lǐ, nǐ háishi huì gǎndào lěng.
examples.en: Although you're dressed very warmly, you will still feel cold in such cold weather.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_尽管但是_jǐnguǎn_dànshì_-_Although_but_20231230_尽管你穿得很保暖但是在这样的寒冷天气里你还是会感到冷.mp3

examples.cn: 尽管她失败了很多次，但是她仍然坚持不放弃。
examples.pinyin: Jǐnguǎn tā shībài le hěnduō cì, dànshì tā réngrán jiānchí bù fàngqì.
examples.en: Although she has failed many times, she still insists on not giving up.

title: 不得不 (bùdébù) - Have to, can't help but
short_explanation: Used to express something that is inevitable or unavoidable.
long_explanation: The Mandarin Chinese phrase '不得不 (bùdébù)' is used to express the necessity or inevitability of an action or situation. This phrase is equivalent to 'have to' or 'cannot help but' in English. It is used to describe situations or actions that are not able to be avoided or that have to occur, regardless of personal preference or other factors.
formation: Subject + 不得不 + Verb + Rest of the sentence

examples.cn: 我不得不承认，他的观点非常精确。
examples.pinyin: Wǒ bùdébù chéngrèn, tā de guāndiǎn fēicháng jīngquè.
examples.en: I have to admit, his view is very precise.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_不得不_bùdébù_-_Have_to_cant_help_but_20231230_我不得不承认他的观点非常精确.mp3

examples.cn: 因为下雨，我们不得不取消野餐。
examples.pinyin: Yīn wèi xiàyǔ, wǒmén bùdébù qǔxiāo yěcān.
examples.en: Because it's raining, we have to cancel the picnic.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_不得不_bùdébù_-_Have_to_cant_help_but_20231230_因为下雨我们不得不取消野餐.mp3

examples.cn: 她不得不早点离开派对，因为她明天早上有一个重要的会议。
examples.pinyin: Tā bùdébù zǎodiǎn líkāi pàiduì, yīnwèi tā míngtiān zǎoshang yǒu yīgè zhòngyào de huìyì.
examples.en: She can't help but leave the party early, because she has an important meeting tomorrow morning.

examples.cn: 我不得不早点睡觉，因为我明天要早起。

title: 既然 (jìrán) - Since, given that
short_explanation: Used to indicate the reasoning for a situation or action based on an existing fact or condition.
long_explanation: The Mandarin Chinese expression '既然 (jìrán)' is used to refer to an existing fact or condition and based on that, to provide a logical reason for a certain situation or action. It is similar to 'since' or 'given that' in English.
formation: 既然 + Fact/Cause, Subject + should/need to + Verb/Action

examples.cn: 既然明天是假日，我们应该去公园散散步。
examples.pinyin: Jìrán míngtiān shì jiàrì, wǒmen yīnggāi qù gōngyuán sànsànbù.
examples.en: Since tomorrow is a holiday, we should go to the park for a walk.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_既然_jìrán_-_Since_given_that_20231230_既然明天是假日我们应该去公园散散步.mp3

examples.cn: 既然你已经决定要去留学，那你就应该努力学习中文。
examples.pinyin: Jìrán nǐ yǐjīng juédìng yào qù liúxué, nà nǐ jiù yīnggāi nǔlì xuéxí zhōngwén.
examples.en: Since you have decided to study abroad, you should study Chinese hard.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_既然_jìrán_-_Since_given_that_20231230_既然你已经决定要去留学那你就应该努力学习中文.mp3

examples.cn: 既然你不喜欢这家餐馆的菜，为什么还要来？
examples.pinyin: Jìrán nǐ bù xǐhuān zhè jiā cānguǎn de cài, wèishénme hái yào lái?
examples.en: Since you don't like the food at this restaurant, why are you still coming?
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_既然_jìrán_-_Since_given_that_20231230_既然你不喜欢这家餐馆的菜为什么还要来.mp3

examples.cn: 既然天气这么冷，我们就应该多穿点儿衣服。
examples.pinyin: Jìrán tiānqì zhème lěng, wǒmen jiù yīnggāi duō chuān diǎnr yīfu.
examples.en: Since it's so cold, we should wear more clothes.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_既然_jìrán_-_Since_given_that_20231230_既然天气这么冷我们就应该多穿点儿衣服.mp3

title: 无论...都... (wúlùn... dōu...) - No matter... all...
short_explanation: Used to express a universal condition or conclusion regardless of varying circumstances.
long_explanation: The Mandarin Chinese phrase '无论...都...' (wúlùn... dōu...) is used to indicate that no matter the situation or condition, the conclusion or result stays the same. It can be translated into English as 'no matter...all...'. It allows a speaker to express assertive totality about a condition or outcome.

examples.cn: 无论天气好不好，我们都要去爬山。
examples.pinyin: Wúlùn tiānqì hǎo bú hǎo, wǒmen dōu yào qù páshān.
examples.en: No matter whether the weather is good or not, we are going to climb the mountain.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_无论都_wúlùn_dōu_-_No_matter_all_20231230_无论天气好不好我们都要去爬山.mp3

examples.cn: 无论你去不去，我都会去那个派对。
examples.pinyin: Wúlùn nǐ qù bù qù, wǒ dōu huì qù nàge pàiduì.
examples.en: No matter whether you go or not, I will go to that party.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_无论都_wúlùn_dōu_-_No_matter_all_20231230_无论你去不去我都会去那个派对.mp3

examples.cn: 无论成绩好坏，都应该对自己有信心。
examples.pinyin: Wúlùn chéngjī hǎo huài, dōu yīnggāi duì zìjǐ yǒu xìnxīn.
examples.en: No matter whether the grades are good or bad, one should have confidence in themselves.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_无论都_wúlùn_dōu_-_No_matter_all_20231230_无论成绩好坏都应该对自己有信心.mp3

examples.cn: 无论工作多么忙，我都会找时间去健身房。
examples.pinyin: Wúlùn gōngzuò duōme máng, wǒ dōu huì zhǎo shíjiān qù jiànshēnfáng.
examples.en: No matter how busy I am with work, I will find time to go to the gym.

title: 无非 (wúfēi) - Nothing but, merely
short_explanation: Used to highlight that something is not more than what is being stated.
long_explanation: The Mandarin Chinese phrase '无非 (wúfēi)' is used to express 'nothing but' or 'merely'. It is used to specify the limit or simplicity of something, minimizing the complexity, diversity, or gravity by suggesting it is nothing beyond the given explanation. '无非' often functions as an adverb to modify the following sentence.
formation: Subject + 无非 + Verb/Adjective + Rest of the sentence

examples.cn: 他无非是想要多争取一点时间。
examples.pinyin: Tā wúfēi shì xiǎngyào duō zhēngqǔ yīdiǎn shíjiān.
examples.en: He is merely trying to gain a little more time.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_无非_wúfēi_-_Nothing_but_merely_20231230_他无非是想要多争取一点时间.mp3

examples.cn: 她无非想让我们开心一点。
examples.pinyin: Tā wúfēi xiǎng ràng wǒmen kāixīn yīdiǎn.
examples.en: She merely wants to make us a bit happier.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_无非_wúfēi_-_Nothing_but_merely_20231230_她无非想让我们开心一点.mp3

examples.cn: 典型的柠檬汽水无非就是含有柠檬和糖。
examples.pinyin: Diǎnxíng de níngméng qìshuǐ wúfēi jiùshì hán yǒu níngméng hé táng.
examples.en: Typical lemon soda is nothing but contains lemon and sugar.

examples.cn: 这无非是一个基本的常识问题。
examples.pinyin: Zhè wúfēi shì yīgè jīběn de chángshí wèntí.
examples.en: This is nothing but a basic common sense issue.

title: 难道 (nándào) - Could it be that, is it possible
short_explanation: Used to express doubt, disbelief, surprise or rhetorical questions.
long_explanation: The Mandarin Chinese phrase '难道 (nándào)' is used to indicate disbelief, doubt, surprise or to pose rhetorical questions. This phrase essentially infers 'Could it be that' or 'Is it possible' in English. It puts strong emphasis on the sentiment of the speaker, usually exhibiting shock or disbelief about a certain event or circumstances. Unlike normal questions, sentences with '难道' do not necessarily expect for an answer.

examples.cn: 难道你不知道今天是我的生日吗？
examples.pinyin: Nándào nǐ bù zhīdào jīntiān shì wǒ de shēngrì ma?
examples.en: Could it be that you didn't know today is my birthday?
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_难道_nándào_-_Could_it_be_that_is_it_possible_20231230_难道你不知道今天是我的生日吗.mp3

examples.cn: 难道你不喜欢吃巧克力吗？
examples.pinyin: Nándào nǐ bù xǐhuān chī qiǎokèlì ma?
examples.en: Is it possible that you don't like eating chocolate?
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_难道_nándào_-_Could_it_be_that_is_it_possible_20231230_难道你不喜欢吃巧克力吗.mp3

examples.cn: 难道他真的没有告诉你这个消息吗？
examples.pinyin: Nándào tā zhēn de méiyǒu gàosù nǐ zhège xiāoxi ma?
examples.en: Could it be that he really didn't tell you this news?
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_难道_nándào_-_Could_it_be_that_is_it_possible_20231230_难道他真的没有告诉你这个消息吗.mp3

examples.cn: 难道你还没完成你的作业吗？
examples.pinyin: Nándào nǐ hái méi wánchéng nǐ de zuòyè ma?
examples.en: Is it possible that you still haven't finished your homework?
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_难道_nándào_-_Could_it_be_that_is_it_possible_20231230_难道你还没完成你的作业吗.mp3

title: 假如 (jiǎrú) - If, supposing
short_explanation: Used to present a hypothetical condition or fact.
long_explanation: The Mandarin Chinese phrase '假如 (jiǎrú)' serves the purpose of introducing a condition or a fact that is hypothetical or yet to happen. It translates to 'if' or 'supposing' in English. In other words, '假如' is used when we want to propose a scenario and infer the result of it.

examples.cn: 假如你每天读一小时的书，你的词汇量肯定会大大提升。
examples.pinyin: Jiǎrú nǐ měitiān dú yī xiǎoshí de shū, nǐ de cíhuì liàng kěndìng huì dà dà tíshēng.
examples.en: If you read books for an hour each day, your vocabulary will surely improve significantly.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_假如_jiǎrú_-_If_supposing_20231230_假如你每天读一小时的书你的词汇量肯定会大大提升.mp3

examples.cn: 假如他来北京，我们可以一起去长城游玩。
examples.pinyin: Jiǎrú tā lái běijīng, wǒmen kěyǐ yīqǐ qù chángchéng yóuwán.
examples.en: If he comes to Beijing, we can go to visit the Great Wall together.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_假如_jiǎrú_-_If_supposing_20231230_假如他来北京我们可以一起去长城游玩.mp3

examples.cn: 假如今天下雨，我们的野餐可能要取消。
examples.pinyin: Jiǎrú jīntiān xiàyǔ, wǒmen de yěcān kěnéng yào qǔxiāo.
examples.en: If it rains today, our picnic might have to be cancelled.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_假如_jiǎrú_-_If_supposing_20231230_假如今天下雨我们的野餐可能要取消.mp3

examples.cn: 假如我当初没有学习中文，我可能就没有机会在中国工作了。
examples.pinyin: Jiǎrú wǒ dāngchū méiyǒu xuéxí Zhōngwén, wǒ kěnéng jiù méiyǒu jīhuì zài Zhōngguó gōngzuò le.
examples.en: If I hadn't learned Chinese before, I might not have had the opportunity to work in China.

title: 即使...也... (jíshǐ... yě...) - Even if... still...
short_explanation: Used to express that some condition or situation doesn't affect the outcome.
long_explanation: The Mandarin Chinese structure '即使... 也...' is similar to the English 'even if... still...' It is used to convey that irrespective of a certain condition or situation, the result remains the same. The situation or condition is put after '即使' and the result or action is placed after '也'.

examples.cn: 即使下雨，我们也要去公园看花。
examples.pinyin: Jíshǐ xià yǔ, wǒmen yě yào qù gōngyuán kàn huā.
examples.en: Even if it rains, we still want to go to the park to see flowers.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_即使也_jíshǐ_yě_-_Even_if_still_20231230_即使下雨我们也要去公园看花.mp3

examples.cn: 即使我很忙，我也会找时间帮助你完成作业。
examples.pinyin: Jíshǐ wǒ hěn máng, wǒ yě huì zhǎo shíjiān bāngzhù nǐ wánchéng zuòyè.
examples.en: Even if I am very busy, I will still find time to help you complete the homework.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_即使也_jíshǐ_yě_-_Even_if_still_20231230_即使我很忙我也会找时间帮助你完成作业.mp3

examples.cn: 即使明天是个大风天，我也会按时到达那里。
examples.pinyin: Jíshǐ míngtiān shì gè dà fēng tiān, wǒ yě huì ànshí dàodá nàlǐ.
examples.en: Even if there is a big wind tomorrow, I will still arrive there on time.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_即使也_jíshǐ_yě_-_Even_if_still_20231230_即使明天是个大风天我也会按时到达那里.mp3

examples.cn: 即使大家都不同意他的观点，他也坚持自己的看法。
examples.pinyin: Jíshǐ dàjiā dōu bùtóngyì tā de guāndiǎn, tā yě jiānchí zìjǐ de kànfǎ.
examples.en: Even if everyone disagrees with his point of view, he still sticks to his own opinion.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_即使也_jíshǐ_yě_-_Even_if_still_20231230_即使大家都不同意他的观点他也坚持自己的看法.mp3

title: 唯有 (wéiyǒu) - Only have, only
short_explanation: Used to emphasize that only one specific thing or person can fulfill a certain condition or requirement.
long_explanation: The Mandarin Chinese phrase '唯有 (wéiyǒu)' is used to emphasize exclusivity, indicating that only a particular thing, item, individual, or action can satisfy a certain condition or requirement, or bring about a specific result. It is similar to the English expression 'only have' or simply 'only'. The phrase '唯有' can lead either a noun (e.g., only you, only this book) or a verb phrase (e.g., only by doing this).
formation: 唯有 + Noun/Verb Phrase + Rest of the sentence

examples.cn: 唯有勤奋的学习，才能取得考试的成功。
examples.pinyin: Wéiyǒu qínfèn de xuéxí, cáinéng qǔdé kǎoshì de chénggōng.
examples.en: Only by diligent study can one achieve success in exams.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_唯有_wéiyǒu_-_Only_have_only_20231230_唯有勤奋的学习才能取得考试的成功.mp3

examples.cn: 唯有通过大量阅读，我们才能扩大词汇量。
examples.pinyin: Wéiyǒu tōngguò dàliàng yuèdú, wǒmen cáinéng kuòdà cíhuìliàng.
examples.en: Only through a great deal of reading can we expand our vocabulary.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_唯有_wéiyǒu_-_Only_have_only_20231230_唯有通过大量阅读我们才能扩大词汇量.mp3

examples.cn: 唯有你能理解我的痛苦。
examples.pinyin: Wéiyǒu nǐ néng lǐjiě wǒ de tòngkǔ.
examples.en: Only you can understand my pain.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_唯有_wéiyǒu_-_Only_have_only_20231230_唯有你能理解我的痛苦.mp3

examples.cn: 唯有爱能战胜恨。
examples.pinyin: Wéiyǒu ài néng zhànshèng hèn.
examples.en: Only love can conquer hate.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_唯有_wéiyǒu_-_Only_have_only_20231230_唯有爱能战胜恨.mp3

title: 不如 (bùrú) - Not as good as, inferior to
short_explanation: Used to compare two things and express that the first is not as good as the second.
long_explanation: The Mandarin Chinese word '不如 (bùrú)' is a comparative term used to compare one thing with another and express an opinion that the first thing is not as good as or inferior to the second. This term is used to clearly compare various aspects such as abilities, things, situations, etc. It is basically equivalent to the English phrase 'not as good as' or 'inferior to'.
formation: Subject + 不如 + comparative object + rest of sentence.

examples.cn: 我的中文水平不如他的好，所以我需要更多的练习。
examples.pinyin: Wǒ de Zhōngwén shuǐpíng bùrú tā de hǎo, suǒyǐ wǒ xūyào gèng duō de liànxí.
examples.en: My Chinese level is not as good as his, so I need more practice.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_不如_bùrú_-_Not_as_good_as_inferior_to_20231230_我的中文水平不如他的好所以我需要更多的练习.mp3

examples.cn: 这个餐厅的食物不如那个餐厅的美味。
examples.pinyin: Zhège cāntīng de shíwù bùrú nàge cāntīng de měiwèi.
examples.en: The food in this restaurant is not as delicious as in that restaurant.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_不如_bùrú_-_Not_as_good_as_inferior_to_20231230_这个餐厅的食物不如那个餐厅的美味.mp3

examples.cn: 不如我们去看电影放松一下吧，而不是在家里做作业。
examples.pinyin: Bùrú wǒmen qù kàn diànyǐng fàngsōng yīxià ba, ér bùshì zài jiā lǐ zuò zuòyè.
examples.en: How about we go to see a movie and relax instead of doing homework at home?
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_不如_bùrú_-_Not_as_good_as_inferior_to_20231230_不如我们去看电影放松一下吧而不是在家里做作业.mp3

examples.cn: 这个城市的气候不如那个城市的舒适。
examples.pinyin: Zhège chéngshì de qìhòu bùrú nàge chéngshì de shūshì.
examples.en: The climate in this city is not as comfortable as in that city.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_不如_bùrú_-_Not_as_good_as_inferior_to_20231230_这个城市的气候不如那个城市的舒适.mp3

title: 逐渐 (zhújiàn) - Gradually
short_explanation: Used to indicate that something is happening gradually over a period of time.
long_explanation: The Mandarin Chinese term '逐渐 (zhújiàn)' is used to describe something occurring gradually or bit by bit over a certain timeline. It is equivalent to 'gradually' or 'increasingly' in English. This term is often used to describe changes that do not occur instantly, but rather unfold over time.
formation: Subject + 逐渐 + Verb + Rest of the sentence

examples.cn: 春天来了，天气也逐渐暖和起来了。
examples.pinyin: Chūntiān lái le, tiānqì yě zhújiàn nuǎn hé qǐlái le.
examples.en: Spring has come, and the weather is gradually getting warmer.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_逐渐_zhújiàn_-_Gradually_20231230_春天来了天气也逐渐暖和起来了.mp3

examples.cn: 通过不断的努力，她逐渐提高了她的汉语水平。
examples.pinyin: Tōngguò bùduàn de nǔlì, tā zhújiàn tígāo le tā de hànyǔ shuǐpíng.
examples.en: Through constant efforts, she gradually improved her Chinese level.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_逐渐_zhújiàn_-_Gradually_20231230_通过不断的努力她逐渐提高了她的汉语水平.mp3

examples.cn: 随着时间的推移，我对中国文化的理解逐渐加深了。
examples.pinyin: Suízhe shíjiān de tuīyí, wǒ duì Zhōngguó wénhuà de lǐjiě zhújiàn jiāshēn le.
examples.en: With the passage of time, my understanding of Chinese culture has gradually deepened.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_逐渐_zhújiàn_-_Gradually_20231230_随着时间的推移我对中国文化的理解逐渐加深了.mp3

examples.cn: 他逐渐适应了在中国的生活。
examples.pinyin: Tā zhújiàn shìyìng le zài Zhōngguó de shēnghuó.
examples.en: He gradually adapted to life in China.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_逐渐_zhújiàn_-_Gradually_20231230_他逐渐适应了在中国的生活.mp3

title: 反而 (fǎn'ér) - On the contrary, instead
short_explanation: Used to express something that happens as a result that is the opposite of what was expected or desired.
long_explanation: The Mandarin Chinese word '反而(fǎn'ér)' is often used when the outcome of an action is contrary to what was initially expected or intended. It denotes an element of surprise, as things did not go as initially predicted. As such, its closest English equivalents would be phrases like 'on the contrary', or 'instead'.
formation: Subject + Action that was expected or desired + 反而 + What actually happened.

examples.cn: 他本来想让步，反而让事情更复杂了。
examples.pinyin: Tā běnlái xiǎng ràngbù, fǎn'ér ràng shìqíng gèng fùzá le.
examples.en: He originally intended to yield, but on the contrary, he made things more complicated.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_反而_fǎnér_-_On_the_contrary_instead_20231230_他本来想让步反而让事情更复杂了.mp3

examples.cn: 我提醒她要小心，反而让她更紧张了。
examples.pinyin: Wǒ tíxǐng tā yào xiǎoxīn, fǎn'ér ràng tā gèng jǐnzhāng le.
examples.en: I reminded her to be careful, but instead, it made her more nervous.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_反而_fǎnér_-_On_the_contrary_instead_20231230_我提醒她要小心反而让她更紧张了.mp3

examples.cn: 我以为吃药会好些，反而病得更重。
examples.pinyin: Wǒ yǐwéi chī yào huì hǎo xiē, fǎn'ér bìng de gèng zhòng.
examples.en: I thought taking medicine would make me feel better, but on the contrary, I got sicker.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_反而_fǎnér_-_On_the_contrary_instead_20231230_我以为吃药会好些反而病得更重.mp3

examples.cn: 他想通过降价来吸引顾客，反而让顾客觉得产品质量差。
examples.pinyin: Tā xiǎng tōngguò jiàngjià lái xīyǐn gùkè, fǎn'ér ràng gùkè juéde chǎnpǐn zhìliàng chà.
examples.en: He thought lowering the price would attract customers, but instead, it made customers think the product was of poor quality.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_反而_fǎnér_-_On_the_contrary_instead_20231230_他想通过降价来吸引顾客反而让顾客觉得产品质量差.mp3

title: 避免 (bìmiǎn) - To avoid, to prevent
short_explanation: Used to express the action of avoiding or preventing something from happening.
long_explanation: The Mandarin Chinese term '避免 (bìmiǎn)' represents the action of preventing or avoiding an event, situation or action from happening. It is equivalent to 'to avoid' or 'to prevent' in English. This term is often used in circumstances where one needs to sidestep or avert a potential problem or unpleasant situation.
formation: Subject + 避免 + Verb/Adjective + Rest of the sentence

examples.cn: 我每天运动来避免感觉疲劳。
examples.pinyin: Wǒ měitiān yùndòng lái bìmiǎn gǎnjué píláo.
examples.en: I exercise every day to avoid feeling tired.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_避免_bìmiǎn_-_To_avoid_to_prevent_20231230_我每天运动来避免感觉疲劳.mp3

examples.cn: 我们必须避免浪费食物，因为这对环境非常不利。
examples.pinyin: Wǒmen bìxū bìmiǎn làngfèi shíwù, yīnwèi zhè duì huánjìng fēicháng bùlì.
examples.en: We must avoid wasting food because it's very harmful to the environment.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_避免_bìmiǎn_-_To_avoid_to_prevent_20231230_我们必须避免浪费食物因为这对环境非常不利.mp3

examples.cn: 他戴上太阳镜以避免阳光直射他的眼睛。
examples.pinyin: Tā dài shàng tàiyángjìng yǐ bìmiǎn yángguāng zhíshè tā de yǎnjīng.
examples.en: He put on sunglasses to avoid direct sunlight into his eyes.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_避免_bìmiǎn_-_To_avoid_to_prevent_20231230_他戴上太阳镜以避免阳光直射他的眼睛.mp3

examples.cn: 为了避免交通拥堵，我选择在早晨离开公司。
examples.pinyin: Wèile bìmiǎn jiāotōng yōngjǔ, wǒ xuǎnzé zài zǎochén líkāi gōngsī.
examples.en: To avoid traffic congestion, I chose to leave the office in the morning.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_避免_bìmiǎn_-_To_avoid_to_prevent_20231230_为了避免交通拥堵我选择在早晨离开公司.mp3

title: 尽管如此 (jǐnguǎn rúcǐ) - Even so, nevertheless
short_explanation: Used to express a contrast, exception or contradiction to the previous statement.
long_explanation: The Mandarin Chinese phrase '尽管如此 (jǐnguǎn rúcǐ)' is a conjunction used to provide a contrasting statement to what has previously been said. The phrase can be translated to 'even so' or 'nevertheless' in English. This phrase signifies disagreement or contradiction, and is used to introduce another perspective or comment that contrasts with the preceding information or viewpoint.

examples.cn: 他的汉语水平很高，尽管如此，他还是认为自己需要更多的练习。
examples.pinyin: Tā de hànyǔ shuǐpíng hěn gāo, jǐnguǎn rúcǐ, tā háishì rènwéi zìjǐ xūyào gèng duō de liànxí.
examples.en: His level of Chinese is very high, even so, he still thinks he needs more practice.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_尽管如此_jǐnguǎn_rúcǐ_-_Even_so_nevertheless_20231230_他的汉语水平很高尽管如此他还是认为自己需要更多的练习.mp3

examples.cn: 我们已经等了很长时间，尽管如此，我们决定继续等下去。
examples.pinyin: Wǒmen yǐjīng děng le hěn cháng shíjiān, jǐnguǎn rúcǐ, wǒmen juédìng jìxù děng xiàqù.
examples.en: We have already been waiting for a long time, nevertheless, we decided to continue to wait.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_尽管如此_jǐnguǎn_rúcǐ_-_Even_so_nevertheless_20231230_我们已经等了很长时间尽管如此我们决定继续等下去.mp3

examples.cn: 我知道考试会很难，尽管如此，我仍然全力以赴。
examples.pinyin: Wǒ zhīdào kǎoshì huì hěn nán, jǐnguǎn rúcǐ, wǒ réngrán quánlìyǐfù.
examples.en: I know the exam will be hard, even so, I still gave it my all.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_尽管如此_jǐnguǎn_rúcǐ_-_Even_so_nevertheless_20231230_我知道考试会很难尽管如此我仍然全力以赴.mp3

examples.cn: 虽然这个电影好看，尽管如此，我不喜欢其中的角色。
examples.pinyin: Suīrán zhège diànyǐng hǎokàn, jǐnguǎn rúcǐ, wǒ bù xǐhuān qízhōng de juésè.
examples.en: Even though this movie is good, nevertheless, I don't like the characters in it.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_尽管如此_jǐnguǎn_rúcǐ_-_Even_so_nevertheless_20231230_虽然这个电影好看尽管如此我不喜欢其中的角色.mp3

title: 为了 (wèile) - In order to, for the sake of
short_explanation: Used to indicate the purpose or intention behind an action.
long_explanation: In Mandarin Chinese, '为了 (wèile)' is a preposition that is used to express a specific purpose, intention, or goal. This phrase is typically placed at the beginning of a sentence to indicate the reason behind an action or decision. It equates to 'in order to' or 'for the sake of' in English.
formation: 为了 + Purpose/Goal, Subject + Verb + Object

examples.cn: 为了保持健康，我决定每天做运动。
examples.pinyin: Wèile bǎochí jiànkāng, wǒ juédìng měitiān zuò yùndòng.
examples.en: In order to stay healthy, I decided to exercise every day.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_为了_wèile_-_In_order_to_for_the_sake_of_20231230_为了保持健康我决定每天做运动.mp3

examples.cn: 他为了完成项目，熬夜工作了一个星期。
examples.pinyin: Tā wèile wánchéng xiàngmù, áoyè gōngzuòle yīgè xīngqī.
examples.en: He worked all night for a week in order to complete the project.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_为了_wèile_-_In_order_to_for_the_sake_of_20231230_他为了完成项目熬夜工作了一个星期.mp3

examples.cn: 为了明年的考试，我们需要从现在开始复习。
examples.pinyin: Wèile míngnián de kǎoshì, wǒmen xūyào cóng xiànzài kāishǐ fùxí.
examples.en: In order to prepare for next year's exam, we need to start reviewing from now.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_为了_wèile_-_In_order_to_for_the_sake_of_20231230_为了明年的考试我们需要从现在开始复习.mp3

examples.cn: 为了她的笑容，我愿意做任何事情。
examples.pinyin: Wèile tā de xiàoróng, wǒ yuànyì zuò rènhé shìqíng.
examples.en: For her smile, I would do anything.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_为了_wèile_-_In_order_to_for_the_sake_of_20231230_为了她的笑容我愿意做任何事情.mp3

title: 反之 (fǎnzhī) - On the other hand, conversely
short_explanation: Used to indicate and introduce an opposing or contrasting point.
long_explanation: The Mandarin Chinese word '反之 (fǎnzhī)' is an adverb used to introduce a contrasting idea or a statement that states the reverse of a previous statement. This term can be used to present varying perspectives, differing situations or contrasting circumstances. In English, it can translate to 'on the other hand', 'conversely', or 'otherwise'.

examples.cn: 如果你努力学习，你会取得成功，反之，如果你骄傲自满，你会失败。
examples.pinyin: Rúguǒ nǐ nǔlì xuéxí, nǐ huì qǔdé chénggōng, fǎnzhī, rúguǒ nǐ jiāo'ào zìmǎn, nǐ huì shībài.
examples.en: If you study hard, you will succeed, on the other hand, if you are complacent, you will fail.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_反之_fǎnzhī_-_On_the_other_hand_conversely_20231230_如果你努力学习你会取得成功反之如果你骄傲自满你会失败.mp3

examples.cn: 这种草药对于一些人来说很有效，反之，对于其他人可能没什么效果。
examples.pinyin: Zhè zhǒng cǎoyào duìyú yìxiē rén lái shuō hěn yǒuxiào, fǎnzhī, duìyú qítā rén kěnéng méishénme xiàoguǒ.
examples.en: This herbal medicine is very effective for some people, on the other hand, it may not have any effect on others.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_反之_fǎnzhī_-_On_the_other_hand_conversely_20231230_这种草药对于一些人来说很有效反之对于其他人可能没什么效果.mp3

examples.cn: 父亲是个保守的人，总是遵循传统的做法，反之，儿子则是个勇于创新的人。
examples.pinyin: Fùqīn shìgè bǎoshǒu de rén, zǒng shì zūnxún chuántǒng de zuòfǎ, fǎnzhī, érzi zé shìgè yǒngyú chuàngxīn de rén.
examples.en: The father is a conservative man, always following traditional practices, on the other hand, the son is a man who dares to innovate.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_反之_fǎnzhī_-_On_the_other_hand_conversely_20231230_父亲是个保守的人总是遵循传统的做法反之儿子则是个勇于创新的人.mp3

examples.cn: 你如果顺从了别人的意愿，那么你就永远不能满足自己，反之，如果你选择自己的道路，那你就有可能实现自己的梦想。
examples.pinyin: Nǐ rúguǒ shùncóng le biérén de yìyuàn, nàme nǐ jiù yǒngyuǎn bùnéng mǎnzú zìjǐ, fǎnzhī, rúguǒ nǐ xuǎnzé zìjǐ de dàolù, nà nǐ jiù yǒu kěnéng shíxiàn zìjǐ de mèngxiǎng.
examples.en: If you comply with the wishes of others, then you can never satisfy yourself, on the other hand, if you choose your own path, then you may realize your dreams.

title: 例如 (lìrú) - For example
short_explanation: This is a conjunction used to introduce examples.
long_explanation: The term '例如 (lìrú)' plays the similar role as 'for example' in English. It is used when the speaker wants to provide an instance or case to illustrate a point. With the usage of '例如', the speaker doesn't have to fully explain the scenario, but can simplify the statement by giving an example.

examples.cn: 我喜欢各种运动，例如游泳、篮球和慢跑。
examples.pinyin: Wǒ xǐhuān gè zhǒng yùndòng, lìrú yóuyǒng, lánqiú hé mànpǎo.
examples.en: I like various sports, for example, swimming, basketball, and jogging.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_例如_lìrú_-_For_example_20231230_我喜欢各种运动例如游泳篮球和慢跑.mp3

examples.cn: 我们可以去很多有趣的地方，例如博物馆或者公园。
examples.pinyin: Wǒmen kěyǐ qù hěnduō yǒuqù de dìfang, lìrú bówùguǎn huòzhě gōngyuán.
examples.en: We can go to many interesting places, for example, museums or parks.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_例如_lìrú_-_For_example_20231230_我们可以去很多有趣的地方例如博物馆或者公园.mp3

examples.cn: 他善于很多艺术，例如画画和弹琴。
examples.pinyin: Tā shànyú hěn duō yìshù, lìrú huàhuà hé tán qín.
examples.en: He is good at many arts, for example, painting and playing the piano.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_例如_lìrú_-_For_example_20231230_他善于很多艺术例如画画和弹琴.mp3

examples.cn: 你可以吃很多种水果来补充维生素，例如苹果、香蕉和葡萄。
examples.pinyin: Nǐ kěyǐ chī hěnduō zhǒng shuǐguǒ lái bǔchōng wéishēngsù, lìrú píngguǒ, xiāngjiāo hé pútáo.
examples.en: You can eat many kinds of fruits to replenish vitamins, for example, apples, bananas, and grapes.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_例如_lìrú_-_For_example_20231230_你可以吃很多种水果来补充维生素例如苹果香蕉和葡萄.mp3

title: 尤其 (yóuqí) - Especially, particularly
short_explanation: Used to give special emphasis to the following word, phrase, or clause.
long_explanation: The Mandarin Chinese word '尤其 (yóuqí)' is used to give special emphasis or to specify something more distinctive or specific in context. It can be closely translated to 'especially' or 'particularly' in English. This adverb is used to underscore a point or to single out one or more elements in comparison to others.
formation: Subject + Verb/Adjective + 尤其 + rest of the sentence

examples.cn: 我喜欢各种运动，尤其喜欢游泳。
examples.pinyin: Wǒ xǐhuan gè zhǒng yùndòng, yóuqí xǐhuan yóuyǒng.
examples.en: I like all kinds of sports, especially swimming.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_尤其_yóuqí_-_Especially_particularly_20231230_我喜欢各种运动尤其喜欢游泳.mp3

examples.cn: 这本书的内容都很有趣，尤其第三章的故事非常吸引人。
examples.pinyin: Zhè běn shū de nèiróng dōu hěn yǒuqù, yóuqí dì sān zhāng de gùshì fēicháng xīyǐnrén.
examples.en: The content of this book is very interesting, especially the story in the third chapter is very appealing.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_尤其_yóuqí_-_Especially_particularly_20231230_这本书的内容都很有趣尤其第三章的故事非常吸引人.mp3

examples.cn: 我喜欢吃水果，尤其喜欢吃苹果。
examples.pinyin: Wǒ xǐhuan chī shuǐguǒ, yóuqí xǐhuan chī píngguǒ.
examples.en: I like to eat fruits, especially apples.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_尤其_yóuqí_-_Especially_particularly_20231230_我喜欢吃水果尤其喜欢吃苹果.mp3

examples.cn: 北京的春天和秋天尤其美丽。
examples.pinyin: Běijīng de chūntiān hé qiūtiān yóuqí měilì.
examples.en: The spring and autumn in Beijing are particularly beautiful.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_尤其_yóuqí_-_Especially_particularly_20231230_北京的春天和秋天尤其美丽.mp3

title: 由于 (yóuyú) - Due to, because of
short_explanation: Used to indicate a reason or cause in a causal relationship.
long_explanation: The Mandarin Chinese preposition '由于 (yóuyú)' acts as a conjunction to express causation, much like 'due to' or 'because of' in English. It is often used to establish a cause-effect relationship between two clauses, with the causative clause typically preceding the result clause in a sentence.

examples.cn: 由于天气太冷，我们决定待在家里。
examples.pinyin: Yóuyú tiānqì tài lěng, wǒmen juédìng dāi zài jiā lǐ.
examples.en: Due to the weather being too cold, we decided to stay at home.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_由于_yóuyú_-_Due_to_because_of_20231230_由于天气太冷我们决定待在家里.mp3

examples.cn: 由于他没有提前预订，所有的房间都订满了。
examples.pinyin: Yóuyú tā méiyǒu tíqián yùdìng, suǒyǒu de fángjiān dōu dìng mǎn le.
examples.en: Because he didn't book in advance, all the rooms were full.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_由于_yóuyú_-_Due_to_because_of_20231230_由于他没有提前预订所有的房间都订满了.mp3

examples.cn: 由于交通堵塞，我们错过了电影。
examples.pinyin: Yóuyú jiāotōng dǔsè, wǒmen cuòguò le diànyǐng.
examples.en: Due to traffic jam, we missed the movie.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_由于_yóuyú_-_Due_to_because_of_20231230_由于交通堵塞我们错过了电影.mp3

examples.cn: 由于她总是迟到，所以经理决定解雇她。
examples.pinyin: Yóuyú tā zǒng shì chídào, suǒyǐ jīnglǐ juédìng jiěgù tā.
examples.en: Due to her always being late, the manager decided to fire her.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_由于_yóuyú_-_Due_to_because_of_20231230_由于她总是迟到所以经理决定解雇她.mp3

title: 不管...都... (bùguǎn... dōu...) - No matter... always...
short_explanation: This is a pattern used to express 'no matter what or how...', 'regardless of...' or 'despite...' in English.
long_explanation: The structure '不管...都...' in Mandarin Chinese is a conjunction used to express a condition and the result, where the result is always the same regardless the condition. It is used to indicate a situation or action that happens irrespective of some variable factor. The '都' part can be understood as 'always' or 'in any case'.

examples.cn: 不管天气怎么样，他每天都去公园跑步。
examples.pinyin: Bùguǎn tiānqì zěnme yàng, tā měitiān dōu qù gōngyuán pǎobù.
examples.en: No matter what the weather is like, he always goes to the park to run every day.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_不管都_bùguǎn_dōu_-_No_matter_always_20231230_不管天气怎么样他每天都去公园跑步.mp3

examples.cn: 不管你去不去，我都会参加那个派对。
examples.pinyin: Bùguǎn nǐ qù bù qù, wǒ dōu huì cānjiā nàgè pàiduì.
examples.en: Whether you go or not, I will attend that party.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_不管都_bùguǎn_dōu_-_No_matter_always_20231230_不管你去不去我都会参加那个派对.mp3

examples.cn: 不管我工作多么忙，我都会找时间健身。
examples.pinyin: Bùguǎn wǒ gōngzuò duōme máng, wǒ dōu huì zhǎo shíjiān jiànshēn.
examples.en: No matter how busy I am with work, I always find time to work out.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_不管都_bùguǎn_dōu_-_No_matter_always_20231230_不管我工作多么忙我都会找时间健身.mp3

examples.cn: 不管路有多远，我都会走到目的地。
examples.pinyin: Bùguǎn lù yǒu duō yuǎn, wǒ dōu huì zǒu dào mùdìdì.
examples.en: No matter how far the journey is, I will always reach my destination.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_不管都_bùguǎn_dōu_-_No_matter_always_20231230_不管路有多远我都会走到目的地.mp3

title: 非...不可 (fēi... bùkě) - Must, have to
short_explanation: Used to emphasize the necessity, urgency, or inevitability of an action.
long_explanation: The Mandarin Chinese expression '非...不可 (fēi... bùkě)' is used to stress that something must be done or has to happen. It is an idiomatic way of expressing a compelling need or obligation to perform a certain action or event. It exemplifies the importance of the action, indicating that it cannot be avoided or ignored.

examples.cn: 我非到中国去学习中文不可，这对我来说是个非常重要的决定。
examples.pinyin: Wǒ fēi dào Zhōngguó qù xuéxí Zhōngwén bùkě, zhè duì wǒ lái shuō shì gè fēicháng zhòngyào de juédìng.
examples.en: I must go to China to study Chinese, this is a very important decision for me.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_非不可_fēi_bùkě_-_Must_have_to_20231230_我非到中国去学习中文不可这对我来说是个非常重要的决定.mp3

examples.cn: 为了保护我们的地球，实现可持续发展，我们非节约资源不可。
examples.pinyin: Wèi le bǎohù wǒmen de dìqiú, shíxiàn kěchíxù fāzhǎn, wǒmen fēi jiéyuē zīyuán bùkě.
examples.en: In order to protect our planet and achieve sustainable development, we must conserve resources.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_非不可_fēi_bùkě_-_Must_have_to_20231230_为了保护我们的地球实现可持续发展我们非节约资源不可.mp3

examples.cn: 他在公司做了一件大错，非向经理道歉不可。
examples.pinyin: Tā zài gōngsī zuòle yījiàn dà cuò, fēi xiàng jīnglǐ dàoqiàn bùkě.
examples.en: He made a big mistake at the company, he must apologize to the manager.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_非不可_fēi_bùkě_-_Must_have_to_20231230_他在公司做了一件大错非向经理道歉不可.mp3

examples.cn: 你非吃早餐不可，这对你的健康非常重要。
examples.pinyin: Nǐ fēi chī zǎocān bùkě, zhè duì nǐ de jiànkāng fēicháng zhòngyào.
examples.en: You must eat breakfast, it is very important for your health.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_非不可_fēi_bùkě_-_Must_have_to_20231230_你非吃早餐不可这对你的健康非常重要.mp3

title: 与其...不如... (yǔqí... bùrú...) - Rather than... it's better to...
short_explanation: Used to express a preference for one action over another.
long_explanation: The Mandarin Chinese phrase '与其...不如...' (yǔqí... bùrú...) is used to indicate a preference for one action or situation over another. It is often used when giving advice or suggesting a preferable alternative. The two events, actions or situations are placed within the structure, similar to the English phrase 'rather than... it's better to...'.
formation: 与其 + Action/Situation A, 不如 + Action/Situation B

examples.cn: 与其在家里浪费时间，不如去图书馆学习。
examples.pinyin: Yǔqí zài jiālǐ làngfèi shíjiān, bùrú qù túshūguǎn xuéxí.
examples.en: Rather than wasting time at home, it's better to go to the library to study.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_与其不如_yǔqí_bùrú_-_Rather_than_its_better_to_20231230_与其在家里浪费时间不如去图书馆学习.mp3

examples.cn: 与其花大钱买新衣服，不如把钱存起来。
examples.pinyin: Yǔqí huā dà qián mǎi xīn yīfu, bùrú bǎ qián cún qǐlái.
examples.en: Rather than spending a lot of money on new clothes, it's better to save the money.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_与其不如_yǔqí_bùrú_-_Rather_than_its_better_to_20231230_与其花大钱买新衣服不如把钱存起来.mp3

examples.cn: 与其天天吃外卖，不如自己煮饭吃。
examples.pinyin: Yǔqí tiāntiān chī wàimài, bùrú zìjǐ zhǔ fàn chī.
examples.en: Rather than eating take-out every day, it's better to cook for yourself.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_与其不如_yǔqí_bùrú_-_Rather_than_its_better_to_20231230_与其天天吃外卖不如自己煮饭吃.mp3

examples.cn: 与其抱怨工作，不如寻找自己喜欢的工作。
examples.pinyin: Yǔqí bàoyuàn gōngzuò, bùrú xúnzhǎo zìjǐ xǐhuan de gōngzuò.
examples.en: Rather than complaining about your job, it's better to look for a job you like.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_与其不如_yǔqí_bùrú_-_Rather_than_its_better_to_20231230_与其抱怨工作不如寻找自己喜欢的工作.mp3

title: 不是...而是... (bùshì... érshì...) - It's not... but...
short_explanation: Used to refute one thing and affirm another. It is equivalent to the English expression 'It's not... but...'.
long_explanation: The phrase '不是…而是…' is used in Mandarin Chinese to negate one thing and affirm another. It's a way to correct a mistaken assumption or to emphasize the true nature of a situation over a possible misleading appearance. This structure gives equal attention to the negative and the positive parts, and it is similar to saying 'It's not... but...' in English.
formation: Subject + 不是 + Misunderstood idea + 而是 + Correct idea

examples.cn: 他不是因为懒惰而是因为病了所以没去上班。
examples.pinyin: Tā bùshì yīnwèi lǎnduò érshì yīnwèi bìng le suǒyǐ méi qù shàngbān.
examples.en: He didn't go to work not because he was lazy, but because he was sick.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_不是而是_bùshì_érshì_-_Its_not_but_20231230_他不是因为懒惰而是因为病了所以没去上班.mp3

examples.cn: 我去中国不是为了旅游，而是为了学习华语。
examples.pinyin: Wǒ qù Zhōngguó bùshì wèile lǚyóu, érshì wèile xuéxí Huáyǔ.
examples.en: I'm going to China not for tourism, but to learn Chinese.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_不是而是_bùshì_érshì_-_Its_not_but_20231230_我去中国不是为了旅游而是为了学习华语.mp3

examples.cn: 她看起来可能很开心，但实际上不是快乐，而是紧张。
examples.pinyin: Tā kàn qǐlái kěnéng hěn kāixīn, dàn shíjì shàng bùshì kuàilè, érshì jǐnzhāng.
examples.en: She might look very happy, but in fact, it's not happiness, but nervousness.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_不是而是_bùshì_érshì_-_Its_not_but_20231230_她看起来可能很开心但实际上不是快乐而是紧张.mp3

examples.cn: 这个决定不是我一个人的，而是我们全家的。
examples.pinyin: Zhège juédìng bùshì wǒ yīgè rén de, érshì wǒmen quánjiā de.
examples.en: This decision is not just mine, but our entire family's.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_不是而是_bùshì_érshì_-_Its_not_but_20231230_这个决定不是我一个人的而是我们全家的.mp3

title: 除非...否则... (chúfēi... fǒuzé...) - Unless... otherwise...
short_explanation: Used to express 'unless... otherwise...'.
long_explanation: '除非...否则...' is a Chinese compound conjunction used to express 'unless... otherwise...'. It is used to indicate that a certain condition must be met before a result can occur. '除非' stands for 'unless', '否则' stands for 'otherwise'. This pattern is used when the speaker believes the condition (stated after '除非') is unlikely to be met.

examples.cn: 除非你按时完成作业，否则你不能去玩。
examples.pinyin: Chúfēi nǐ ànshí wánchéng zuòyè, fǒuzé nǐ bùnéng qù wán.
examples.en: Unless you finish your homework on time, otherwise you can't go play.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_除非否则_chúfēi_fǒuzé_-_Unless_otherwise_20231230_除非你按时完成作业否则你不能去玩.mp3

examples.cn: 除非你节约用水，否则我们的水资源将会枯竭。
examples.pinyin: Chúfēi nǐ jiéyuē yòngshuǐ, fǒuzé wǒmen de shuǐ zīyuán jiāng huì kūjié.
examples.en: Unless you save water, otherwise our water resources will dry up.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_除非否则_chúfēi_fǒuzé_-_Unless_otherwise_20231230_除非你节约用水否则我们的水资源将会枯竭.mp3

examples.cn: 除非你提前预定，否则你可能找不到酒店的空房间。
examples.pinyin: Chúfēi nǐ tíqián yùdìng, fǒuzé nǐ kěnéng zhǎo bùdào jiǔdiàn de kōng fángjiān.
examples.en: Unless you reserve in advance, otherwise you might not find an available room in the hotel.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_除非否则_chúfēi_fǒuzé_-_Unless_otherwise_20231230_除非你提前预定否则你可能找不到酒店的空房间.mp3

examples.cn: 除非我们改变消费习惯，否则地球的资源将会耗尽。
examples.pinyin: Chúfēi wǒmen gǎibiàn xiāofèi xíguàn, fǒuzé dìqiú de zīyuán jiāng huì hàojìn.
examples.en: Unless we change our consumption habits, otherwise the earth's resources will be exhausted.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_除非否则_chúfēi_fǒuzé_-_Unless_otherwise_20231230_除非我们改变消费习惯否则地球的资源将会耗尽.mp3

title: 以至于 (yǐzhìyú) - So that, to the extent that
short_explanation: Used to express the result or consequence of a certain condition or circumstance.
long_explanation: The Mandarin Chinese phrase '以至于 (yǐzhìyú)' is used to show the result or effect brought by a certain condition or situation to the extent that it draws attention. In English, this could be translated as 'so that', 'to the extent that', 'to the point that', or 'so...that'. It emphasizes the intensity or severity of a result or consequence.

examples.cn: 他工作太忙，以至于没有时间和家人在一起。
examples.pinyin: Tā gōngzuò tài máng, yǐzhìyú méiyǒu shíjiān hé jiārén zài yīqǐ.
examples.en: He is so busy with work that he has no time to be with his family.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_以至于_yǐzhìyú_-_So_that_to_the_extent_that_20231230_他工作太忙以至于没有时间和家人在一起.mp3

examples.cn: 她很注意饮食，以至于身材非常好。
examples.pinyin: Tā hěn zhùyì yǐnshí, yǐzhìyú shēncái fēicháng hǎo.
examples.en: She pays so much attention to her diet, to the extent that her figure is very good.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_以至于_yǐzhìyú_-_So_that_to_the_extent_that_20231230_她很注意饮食以至于身材非常好.mp3

examples.cn: 我们公司发展的很快，以至于需要更多的员工。
examples.pinyin: Wǒmen gōngsī fāzhǎn de hěn kuài, yǐzhìyú xūyào gèng duō de yuángōng.
examples.en: Our company is developing so quickly, to the extent that we need more employees.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_以至于_yǐzhìyú_-_So_that_to_the_extent_that_20231230_我们公司发展的很快以至于需要更多的员工.mp3

examples.cn: 这部电影太吸引人，以至于我一口气看了两遍。
examples.pinyin: Zhè bù diànyǐng tài xīyǐn rén, yǐzhìyú wǒ yīkǒuqì kànle liǎng biàn.
examples.en: This movie is so attractive, to the point that I watched it twice in one go.

title: 一旦...就... (yīdàn... jiù...) - Once... then...
short_explanation: Used to express that once a certain condition is met, another event will happen immediately.
long_explanation: The Mandarin Chinese phrase '一旦...就...' (yīdàn... jiù...) is used to express that once a certain condition is met, an event will take place immediately thereafter. It signifies a cause and effect relationship, and the 'once' clause specifies a condition, while the 'then' clause describes the resultant action or consequence.

examples.cn: 一旦你决定好了，就告诉我。
examples.pinyin: Yīdàn nǐ juédìng hǎo le, jiù gàosù wǒ.
examples.en: Once you've made your decision, then tell me.

examples.cn: 一旦开始下雨，我们就得回家。
examples.pinyin: Yīdàn kāishǐ xià yǔ, wǒmen jiù děi huí jiā.
examples.en: Once it starts to rain, we'll have to go home.

examples.cn: 一旦你完成这个项目，就可以去休假了。
examples.pinyin: Yīdàn nǐ wánchéng zhège xiàngmù, jiù kěyǐ qù xiūjià le.
examples.en: Once you complete this project, you can go on vacation.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_一旦就_yīdàn_jiù_-_Once_then_20231230_一旦你完成这个项目就可以去休假了.mp3

examples.cn: 一旦我收到他的邮件，我就会回复他。
examples.pinyin: Yīdàn wǒ shōudào tā de yóujiàn, wǒ jiù huì huífù tā.
examples.en: Once I receive his email, I'll reply to him.
